revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-03 13:55:54.000000000', 'message': "Use undercloud-connection to local for running validations with the CLI

This patch adds the **undercloud_connection** (set to 'ssh' by default)
parameter to the get_tripleo_ansible_inventory() function which allow
the CLI to create a static inventory file with local connection for the
undercloud.

Change-Id: I50d486afe2a11e830c72145154dc2b0764aece07
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Use undercloud-connection to local for running validations with the CLI

This patch adds the **undercloud_connection** (set to 'ssh' by default)
parameter to the get_tripleo_ansible_inventory() function which allow
the CLI to create a static inventory file with local connection for the
undercloud.

Change-Id: I50d486afe2a11e830c72145154dc2b0764aece07
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix Zun Docker remote API host

This makes WS (so e.g. console) always work with the way we
deploy Zun. Otherwise it used the first IP address.

Change-Id: Ib31c5944be2f6fa00cdf5da3e638a590e6bace40
Closes-bug: #1841243
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit c24dcf8a38bb59685540b861ca6bdeea3b510f34)

commit_message:
Link to election results announcement for TC

Since there was no need for a TC poll, there are no poll details to
link as election results. Instead link the E-mail announcement from
the ML archive which includes a brief explanation of the situation.

Change-Id: Icee2c0eaf33fcccb0eb49a76a1296998e6a76e67

This enables an easy use of sphinx-build for both flavors
without too much repetition.

commit_message:
[fedora-atomic][k8s]Disable ssh password authentication

Regarding passwords, they could be guessed if there is no
faild-to-ban-like solution. So it'd better to disable it
for security reasons.

Task: 36300
Story: 2006413

Change-Id: Ie7534c12612750d9aafd4feae5193b34997b22ff

commit_message:
Fix gate issue of placement unit test

The commit b366634af80a3d400adf6e7bb9d2dded64e10d75 changed the
placement client to add "region_name" to "endpoint filter",
but the unit test has not been changed and started to raise
failures on gate.

This patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I6acafaca389261ea76f064092b8c32bcfb4108e1
Related-Bug: #1836917

subject: [WIP] use 'u' while making string to mark them as unicode for python2
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-02 12:40:04.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] use 'u' while making string to mark them as unicode for python2

currently queries are formed using string concatenation so any point
these queries can have special char which make it no longer ascii. The
current code never converted these queries to unicode explicitly.

This is a requirement in python2 since all text in python3 is unicode by
default. This patch marks the initial strings as unicode essentials
coerces any concatenations to unicode

Change-Id: Ie2590fa65b1930623877e821f53e2fad658dd362
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] use 'u' while making string to mark them as unicode for python2

currently queries are formed using string concatenation so any point
these queries can have special char which make it no longer ascii. The
current code never converted these queries to unicode explicitly.

This is a requirement in python2 since all text in python3 is unicode by
default. This patch marks the initial strings as unicode essentials
coerces any concatenations to unicode

Change-Id: Ie2590fa65b1930623877e821f53e2fad658dd362

commit_message:
Use secure websocket for nova serial console proxy when TLS enabled

This resolves an issue where the web browser would complain that it
was trying to connect to insecure websocket when using HTTPS with
horizon.

Change-Id: Ib75cc2bc1b3811bc31badd5fda3db3ed0c59b119
Closes-Bug: #1841914
(cherry picked from commit 94d824dd0eec3f1a37586c03d0b79b074c37653e)

[{'created': '2019-09-03 11:05:13.000000000', 'message': 'ironic-inspector: install the dnsmasq subpackage explicitly

We are splitting the ironic-inspector package into RDO into
ironic-inspector itself and its dnsmasq service. This change
updates kolla to install both packages to avoid breakages when
RDO removes mutual dependency between them.

Change-Id: I2acb070f725aa563781dfe5d325834e1e2675edf
'}]
commit_message:
ironic-inspector: install the dnsmasq subpackage explicitly

We are splitting the ironic-inspector package into RDO into
ironic-inspector itself and its dnsmasq service. This change
updates kolla to install both packages to avoid breakages when
RDO removes mutual dependency between them.

Change-Id: I2acb070f725aa563781dfe5d325834e1e2675edf

commit_message:
heat: Drop aodhclient Requires

It is in requirements.txt but only needed if aodh functionality is
used by heat. So drop it for now until we have a python3 ready
aodhclient package.

Change-Id: I356a641026b6476168fd62df4fc9da9f297f3d0e

[{'created': '2019-09-04 04:52:17.000000000', 'message': 'Change PDF file name

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: Id17cfdce6c38dc30bfaf557be7eee0675fa8f87c
'}]
commit_message:
Change PDF file name

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: Id17cfdce6c38dc30bfaf557be7eee0675fa8f87c

without too much repetition.

commit_message:
Drop use of git.openstack.org

Our cgit instance will be going away and opendev.org is the new
preferred URL for browsing our git repos. Redirects will exist for the
foreseeable future, but it's more efficient to just go directly to the
new locations.

Change-Id: I8f9fbe12b5230e527faaea9fe25d71292a75caa1

commit_message:
Fixes problem with distutils installed packages on Centos and Suse

Centos and (Open)Suse use distutils to install python packages.  Since
version 10 pip will not remove them - and therefore cannot be used to
update those packages.
Implemented is a workaround which is taken from the diskimage-builder.

Change-Id: I2ecfbb00ba6034c3b09aa83a66cd99c85b463fff
Story: 2005899
Task: 33761
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <Andreas.Florath@telekom.de>

subject: [Ansible] Look for inventory in SoftwareConfig options
messages: [{'account_id': 25277, 'date': '2019-03-15 14:45:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-09-04 05:58:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-15 14:45:26.000000000', 'message': '[Ansible] Look for inventory in SoftwareConfig options

Currently, the only way to use a custom inventory is to change the
HEAT_ANSIBLE_INVENTORY environment variable. This becomes a problem when
the inventory has to be changed between playbook runs from two
sequential SoftwareDeployments, as environment variables won't be
reloaded.

This change allows to specify the location of the inventory in the
"options" map for each SoftwareConfig.

Change-Id: I6709213240119e999d4f36e2938b0de9311d2556
'}]
commit_message:
[Ansible] Look for inventory in SoftwareConfig options

Currently, the only way to use a custom inventory is to change the
HEAT_ANSIBLE_INVENTORY environment variable. This becomes a problem when
the inventory has to be changed between playbook runs from two
sequential SoftwareDeployments, as environment variables won't be
reloaded.

This change allows to specify the location of the inventory in the
"options" map for each SoftwareConfig.

Change-Id: I6709213240119e999d4f36e2938b0de9311d2556

commit_message:
Add parameters for dateext in logrotate

I798304a472df41b86a88611c97c2c99131faa0ad introduces
a support of dateext, dateformat and dateyesterday for containerized
logrotate. To use those paramters from T-H-T, this change introduces
3 parameters, LogrotateDateExt, LogrotateDateFormat and
LogrotateDateYesterday.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669604/
Change-Id: I5156199c7ebb5867be8b38ab6441a010ba3d29f5

subject: Rewrite test_hook_docker_cmd to avoid paunch internals
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 12404, 'name': 'Rico Lin', 'email': 'ricolin@ricolky.com', 'username': 'rico.lin'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-08-25 21:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-08-25 22:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-08-25 23:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-09-04 05:32:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-25 21:41:48.000000000', 'message': 'Rewrite test_hook_docker_cmd to avoid paunch internals

This test breaks frequently as it is asserting the docker calls which
paunch is making internally. These calls are changing often, as paunch
is in active development.

This change rewrites the test to be a unit test of hook-docker-cmd.py
specifically, with calls to paunch.apply mocked out.

commit_message:
Rewrite test_hook_docker_cmd to avoid paunch internals

This test breaks frequently as it is asserting the docker calls which
paunch is making internally. These calls are changing often, as paunch
is in active development.

This change rewrites the test to be a unit test of hook-docker-cmd.py
specifically, with calls to paunch.apply mocked out.

Change-Id: Ieeef3e5916e46d006a358f132bbd64f3960e1fcd
Task: 36342

commit_message:
Improve image build

- Remove network-scripts package from guest agent, otherwise image
  creation will fail with network-scripts not found.
- Improve the way to install percona-xtrabackup package on Xenial to
  avoid the failure: "write error: No space left on device"

Change-Id: I6d8de1ad0f675db9635f4762cefc26169e738bbc

commit_message:
Deprecate [disk_utils]iscsi_verify_attempts

It is not used in ironic-lib for anything explicitly iscsi-related.
Rename it, keeping the option present since ironic uses it.

Change-Id: I86f52dc7e36a35ebcd44eee4f317fe93b5d67cd6
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/679463

Add retry for sync_point_update_input_data

update_input_data in sync_point.sync() at times fails with
DBDeadlock. Let's add retry like sync_point_create()

(cherry picked from commit ba9c42b9eb33b98ef68bea8d47852cfe54977b4d)

commit_message:
Fix MariaDB image build

The error in MariaDB installation during the guest image building:

```
apt-get -y install socat percona-xtrabackup
percona-xtrabackup : Depends: libcurl4 (>= 7.16.3) but it is not installable
                     Depends: libgcrypt20 (>= 1.8.0) but 1.6.5-2ubuntu0.5 is to be installed
                     Depends: libssl1.1 (>= 1.1.0) but it is not installable
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
```

This patch fixes the issue based on the process described in
https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/installing-mariadb-deb-files

Change-Id: I368bddabffcc0f11f7181b3a33be1f213f0bdaba

[{'created': '2019-09-04 01:30:48.000000000', 'message': 'Truncate Ussuri election schedule

Since the combined PTL/TC elections resulted in no contested seats,
all candidates were acclaimed and no polls were required. Because of
this, there is no need for a campaigning week or polling week in the
schedule. Shorten these phases to one minute each so that the site
renders the expected state.

Change-Id: Iff1311a8fbcedf3cd5d39e381d68f10bad376d0e
'}]
commit_message:
Truncate Ussuri election schedule

Since the combined PTL/TC elections resulted in no contested seats,
all candidates were acclaimed and no polls were required. Because of
this, there is no need for a campaigning week or polling week in the
schedule. Shorten these phases to one minute each so that the site
renders the expected state.

Change-Id: Iff1311a8fbcedf3cd5d39e381d68f10bad376d0e

commit_message:
Type field missing in snmp data harware.cpu meters

Type field is missing in snmp.yaml for hardware.cpu.*
meters as a result it is throwing Missing field unit
errors in the log files. Adding Type gauge per the
telemetry-measurements documentation.

Change-Id: I4c349d82e3b2b35727c3f814116410dd1ffc8f37
Task: 36428
Story: 2006485
(cherry picked from commit fd9cf6a7bd0371ebb2d4d173fbdf9896f0687034)

commit_message:
Type field missing in snmp data harware.cpu meters

Type field is missing in snmp.yaml for hardware.cpu.*
meters as a result it is throwing Missing field unit
errors in the log files. Adding Type gauge per the
telemetry-measurements documentation.

Change-Id: I4c349d82e3b2b35727c3f814116410dd1ffc8f37
Task: 36428
Story: 2006485

commit_message:
Add support to enable l3 port-forwarding plugin

Allows enabling neutron port forwarding plugin
and l3 extension to forward ports from floating
IP to a fixed neutron port.

Change-Id: Ic25c96a0ddcf4f69acbfb7a58acafec82c3b0aed
Implements: blueprint enable-l3-port-forwarding

[{'created': '2019-08-30 18:32:46.000000000', 'message': "Don't force verbosity of 1 for config-download

Instead, honor the value of verbosity that was specified on the command
line. This will make the ansible tasks less verbose by default, so that
we don't have to add no_log everywhere which actually ends up hiding
useful output.

Change-Id: Ib5060a3e9679b105c76c3c72011c23aee0093dc1
(cherry picked from commit 648cc2bc7d26459cf5aee5d1967f19cb2fafcacc)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't force verbosity of 1 for config-download

Instead, honor the value of verbosity that was specified on the command
line. This will make the ansible tasks less verbose by default, so that
we don't have to add no_log everywhere which actually ends up hiding
useful output.

Change-Id: Ib5060a3e9679b105c76c3c72011c23aee0093dc1
(cherry picked from commit 648cc2bc7d26459cf5aee5d1967f19cb2fafcacc)

commit_message:
Only generate Octavia certs on stack create

We are regenerating octavia certs whenever an overcloud is updated,
breaking any deployments using the auto-generated certs. Certificate
updates after the initial deployment require special handling and
shouldn't be performed by stack updates/upgrades at this time.

Note: depends on changed because the dependent patch was a semantic
backport.

Depends-On: I8088a0a42094b2d038ba29779535a05195138747
Closes-Bug: #1838039
Change-Id: I05f69df627e5637fdb254285cb3ad6d3d8328f90
(cherry picked from commit b61156785517f767a9ad0ee1613588f6b049fc8c)
(cherry picked from commit 2f4dd2c927660e1d950e9d6ef49e4cdc628c94df)

'}, {'created': '2019-08-27 15:16:31.000000000', 'message': '[ceph-osd] get configmap and daemonset names from values

This is to fix name conflict for configmap name "ceph-osd-default" when
we try to create  multiple osd releases as every relase try to create configmap
with same name.

we could add relase name here but that will be a problem for sites deployed with
current logic as upgrade will delete old daemonsets and creates new ds ,so all osd
pods gets recreated at a time, by getting this from values can give us
flexibility to install multiple osd releases with out effecting currently deployed
sites.

Here is  the error if we try multiple osd releases with current logic:

2019-08-27 13:54:16.690 41 ERROR armada.handlers.tiller [-] [chart=ceph-osd-sde]:
Error while installing release ceph-osd-sde: grpc._channel._Rendezvous: \
<_Rendezvous of RPC that terminated with:
        status = StatusCode.UNKNOWN
        details = "release ceph-osd-sde
        failed: configmaps "ceph-osd-default" already exists"

Change-Id: Ibe84582b9ba04c6cbf611e943ecd0a7149c5ab2f
'}]
commit_message:
[ceph-osd] get configmap and daemonset names from values

This is to fix name conflict for configmap name "ceph-osd-default" when
we try to create  multiple osd releases as every relase try to create configmap
with same name.

we could add relase name here but that will be a problem for sites deployed with
current logic as upgrade will delete old daemonsets and creates new ds ,so all osd
pods gets recreated at a time, by getting this from values can give us
flexibility to install multiple osd releases with out effecting currently deployed
sites.

Here is  the error if we try multiple osd releases with current logic:

2019-08-27 13:54:16.690 41 ERROR armada.handlers.tiller [-] [chart=ceph-osd-sde]:
Error while installing release ceph-osd-sde: grpc._channel._Rendezvous: \
<_Rendezvous of RPC that terminated with:
        status = StatusCode.UNKNOWN
        details = "release ceph-osd-sde
        failed: configmaps "ceph-osd-default" already exists"

Change-Id: Ibe84582b9ba04c6cbf611e943ecd0a7149c5ab2f

commit_message:
Bump API microversion to support rebuild bfv instances

This patch add a new microversion 2.68 to support rebuild the
volume-backed server with any image.

Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I76ea0e2f5aa527e3056aaf8f14370a4918543cd7
Implements: blueprint volume-backed-server-rebuild

commit_message:
Allow distribution of non-autogenerated certs

This patch changes the conditional run of the certs generation from
being dependent on the value of generate_certs to whether there are
actual certs present.

Conflicts:
	playbooks/roles/octavia-controller-config/tasks/certificate.yml

Note: this is a semantic backport of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672529/

Change-Id: I8088a0a42094b2d038ba29779535a05195138747
Related-Bug: #1838039

[{'created': '2019-08-30 18:32:31.000000000', 'message': "Don't force verbosity of 1 for config-download

Instead, honor the value of verbosity that was specified on the command
line. This will make the ansible tasks less verbose by default, so that
we don't have to add no_log everywhere which actually ends up hiding

Change-Id: Ib5060a3e9679b105c76c3c72011c23aee0093dc1

commit_message:
Don't force verbosity of 1 for config-download

Instead, honor the value of verbosity that was specified on the command
line. This will make the ansible tasks less verbose by default, so that
we don't have to add no_log everywhere which actually ends up hiding
useful output.

Change-Id: Ib5060a3e9679b105c76c3c72011c23aee0093dc1
(cherry picked from commit 648cc2bc7d26459cf5aee5d1967f19cb2fafcacc)

Security group assignment had to happen after the CONTEXT_WRITER committed
the port information, otherwise the tenant default security group was
always getting assigned even if a different security group was
requested.

In order to ensure that bulk port creation results in the proper
assignment of security groups, add some testing.

Further, the Neutron port API considers security_groups not an optional
part of the API response; therefore Port objects, which are now being
used to create API responses, will no longer consider security groups to
be a nullable field.

Change-Id: Ia1bf80dd86ce4d7124a1f5af4b03e44036870ed2

commit_message:
Add tests for bulk port functioning with security groups

Security group assignment had to happen after the CONTEXT_WRITER committed
the port information, otherwise the tenant default security group was
always getting assigned even if a different security group was
requested.

In order to ensure that bulk port creation results in the proper
assignment of security groups, add some testing.

Change-Id: Ia1bf80dd86ce4d7124a1f5af4b03e44036870ed2

[{'created': '2019-08-29 19:17:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix NFS volume retype with migrate

When migrating a volume to an NFS backend, don't rename the associated
volume file if the original source volume was on the same backend (same
provider_location). Volume migration always deletes the source volume,
so the volume file should *not* be renamed to the original.

Closes-Bug: #1798468
Change-Id: Iadf537521af93bbd28452a54e0e70e7ed18f606c
(cherry picked from commit 33a3a4bf6fe72b093702922e2e5f102d06249375)
(cherry picked from commit 6f3bec3c64e27f7daac830e62de935b2d5ffa20f)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix NFS volume retype with migrate

When migrating a volume to an NFS backend, don't rename the associated
volume file if the original source volume was on the same backend (same
provider_location). Volume migration always deletes the source volume,
so the volume file should *not* be renamed to the original.

Closes-Bug: #1798468
Change-Id: Iadf537521af93bbd28452a54e0e70e7ed18f606c
(cherry picked from commit 33a3a4bf6fe72b093702922e2e5f102d06249375)
(cherry picked from commit 6f3bec3c64e27f7daac830e62de935b2d5ffa20f)

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: Icc28a2fcecc41b7479d62fd6e3bed8e53d89299b

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of

reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I268df41f6f775560580b49fa60f717ba8da88def

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718

Change-Id: Ie3d970ffde85b8f447ec7d2a95041ef59a747d8c

commit_message:
Check path alive before get scsi wwn

In FC environment, when disconnect volume,
if the first path in the loop is failed,
it will lead get scsi wwn to failure.
So I think we need to add path validity check
before get scsi wwn

Change-Id: I9d3a9dac13dcd585330e7b891c61b2626e5aabec
Closes-Bug: 1831621
(cherry picked from commit 3b8d5b7886b9a45df6b666ef594f4a337914856d)

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718

Change-Id: I432a562efb84e486034f97f433186a31a80d4b2d

commit_message:
Fix NovaEnableRbdBackend to be role specific

This [1] change enabled to have role specific NovaEnableRbdBackend
parameter, however global parameter were allways overriding role
specific hiera after it was set via RoleParametersValue

[1]: I9f40a2a3561fcb1d1fec9d9c3c1f9cabaf02650c

Change-Id: Iab58223a6140e42028d4d2a7305c05fd7ae3a9f0

commit_message:
Don't accumulate ansible output uselessly

To not overload mistral, we often call the ansible playbook action with
"trash_output". When that's the case, we can discard stdout immediately,
instead of accumulating it and then discarding it.

Change-Id: Ia3d05d716a8e0a1665f9b9310f7d25370bbcdf8d
(cherry picked from commit 37dee4aa0325a5a64bd95ecded02d33a90efab15)

commit_message:
Exclude influxdb 5.2.3 for Python 2 from g-r

The new version of influxdb client does not handle correctly unicode
characters with Python 2 [1].  It breaks Monasca tempest tests [2].
Client works correctly with Python 3.

[1] https://github.com/influxdata/influxdb-python/issues/633
[2] https://eee3070cd8a3c6b78132-b3e7e1e3e1393434beacfb81ba26faba.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/679311/3/check/monasca-tempest-python2-influxdb/89b6631/testr_results.html.gz

Change-Id: I805ea6d5c06d96779e04639284313fbb0355b196

commit_message:
Fix use of get_server_ip with fixed networks

If a fixed network is used, we see errors like the following in three
compute tests:

KeyError: 'addresses'

This is because get_server_ip expects to be called with a detailed
server response, but in these cases is called with a create server
response, which does not contain the 'addresses' field.

This change fixes the issue by obtaining a detailed server response
where necessary.

Change-Id: I9deeb0e527a8537c71657507cabd81a63a421d9c
Closes-Bug: #1817701

Keystone is updating the project response to include resource-specific
options. The test `test_project_get_equals_list` is looking at explicit
data being returned and prevents the additional field. Keystone does not

commit_message:
"test_project_get_equals_list" allows extra fields

Keystone is updating the project response to include resource-specific
options. The test `test_project_get_equals_list` is looking at explicit
data being returned and prevents the additional field. Keystone does not
(and currently has not plan) to support microversions. This changes the
test checking the returned fields to ensure that the expected fields is
a subset (inclusive) of the returned fields. This allows for Keystone to
iterate and respond with additional fields for future changes.

Any future fields added become part of the contract and should be added
to the expected "fields" list in the test after the new field response
code lands within keystone.

Related-Bug: #1807751
Required-by: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678322/
Change-Id: I266d98503066f3a8027effc43a95f9ad9ff12492

[{'created': '2019-08-20 23:02:05.000000000', 'message': 'Will not force logout when encouter 403 error

When encouter 403 error such as fail to have the permission of an
opertion, user will get logged out when the UI code was written
in angularjs framework.

For example, project->compute->images, if an admin user
has no permission get_project, trying to access images table
currently will have 403 error and force user logout.
Expect just show the error.

Change-Id: I10a6eeb96dd1418449e1d15b1a3869cd4de9cafa
Close-bug: #1840844
'}, {'created': '2019-08-21 14:50:37.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid forced logout when 403 error encountered

Before this change when a 403 error was encountered, such as failure to
have the permission to perform an operation, the user would get logged
out from UI pages written in the AngularJS framework. For example, if an
admin user lacks the get_project permission and tries to access the
images page, project->compute->images, the 403 will forcibly log out
the user.

This change keeps the user logged in when a 403 error is encountered and
displays an error message. The change only affects AngularJS pages.

Change-Id: I10a6eeb96dd1418449e1d15b1a3869cd4de9cafa
Close-bug: #1840844
'}, {'created': '2019-09-03 17:15:45.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid forced logout when 403 error encountered

'}]
commit_message:
Avoid forced logout when 403 error encountered

Before this change when a 403 error was encountered, such as failure to
have the permission to perform an operation, the user would get logged
out from UI pages written in the AngularJS framework. For example, if an
admin user lacks the get_project permission and tries to access the
images page, project->compute->images, the 403 will forcibly log out
the user.

This change keeps the user logged in when a 403 error is encountered and
displays an error message. The change only affects AngularJS pages.

Change-Id: I10a6eeb96dd1418449e1d15b1a3869cd4de9cafa
Closes-bug: #1840844

subject: Force to use markdown to prevent pypi issue
messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-07-01 18:46:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-08-01 10:56:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-05 23:58:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-09-03 20:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-01 18:46:43.000000000', 'message': "Force to use markdown to prevent pypi issue

Recently the pypi team have reintroduce some deactivated tests
on package deployment and especially tests concerning long_description
syntaxe.

If projects don't specify that they use the markdown format the
package deployment will fail if something went wrong in the markdown format.

By example if a project use inline literal this can be an issue due to
the fact that if `long_description_content_type` is missing [1]. The
default format will be `text/x-rst` where code block is different from
markdown.

These changes force to use the markdown format to avoid this kind of issue
on project who use `README` at markdown format.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007459.html

For more details:
https://github.com/pypa/warehouse/issues/5890#issuecomment-494868157

Change-Id: I0f1b5c2f911b6a421525075a8c52cf27da38bf39
"}]
commit_message:
Force to use markdown to prevent pypi issue

Recently the pypi team have reintroduce some deactivated tests
on package deployment and especially tests concerning long_description
syntaxe.

If projects don't specify that they use the markdown format the
package deployment will fail if something went wrong in the markdown format.

By example if a project use inline literal this can be an issue due to
the fact that if `long_description_content_type` is missing [1]. The
default format will be `text/x-rst` where code block is different from
markdown.

These changes force to use the markdown format to avoid this kind of issue
on project who use `README` at markdown format.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007459.html

For more details:
https://github.com/pypa/warehouse/issues/5890#issuecomment-494868157

Change-Id: I0f1b5c2f911b6a421525075a8c52cf27da38bf39

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-22 20:29:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix VolumeAttachment is not bound to a Session

In some cases, when loading a list of volumes using
cinder.objects.VolumeList.get_all we may end up with a SQL alchemy error
like this one:

 sqlalchemy.orm.exc.DetachedInstanceError: Parent instance
 <VolumeAttachment at 0x7f048ff22290> is not bound to a Session; lazy
 load operation of attribute 'volume' cannot proceed (Background on this
 error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/bhk3)

This happens because when loading a Cinder Volume we also load the
volume attachments, so the Volume OVO tries to create the
VolumeAttachmentList OVO, which in turn creates the individual
VolumeAttachment OVOs, but these have the volume field set as expected,
which in this case is not loaded.

In most cases we don't see this issue because the session is still
available and SQLAlchemy will return this information.

Instead of using the dictionary "get" method that will do the lazy
loading we use the hasattr method that will return False if the lazy
loading exception happens when trying to get the volume.

Closes-Bug: #1812913
Change-Id: I253123d5451b32f0e3143916e41aaa1af75561c2

commit_message:
Fix VolumeAttachment is not bound to a Session

In some cases, when loading a list of volumes using
cinder.objects.VolumeList.get_all we may end up with a SQL alchemy error
like this one:

 sqlalchemy.orm.exc.DetachedInstanceError: Parent instance
 <VolumeAttachment at 0x7f048ff22290> is not bound to a Session; lazy
 load operation of attribute 'volume' cannot proceed (Background on this
 error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/bhk3)

This happens because when loading a Cinder Volume we also load the
volume attachments, so the Volume OVO tries to create the
VolumeAttachmentList OVO, which in turn creates the individual
VolumeAttachment OVOs, but these have the volume field set in
expected_attrs, but in this case the volume data is not loaded.

In most cases we don't see this issue because the session is still
available and SQLAlchemy will return this information.

Instead of using the dictionary "get" method that will do the lazy
loading we use the hasattr method that will return False if the lazy
loading exception happens when trying to get the volume.

Depends-On: I9f0fec25444ed865d56d0d250fb6d840ab5b4095
Closes-Bug: #1812913
Change-Id: I253123d5451b32f0e3143916e41aaa1af75561c2

commit_message:
Reuse utils.get_lbaas_spec in lb handler

LoadBalancerHandler._get_lbaas_spec is identical to
utils.get_lbaas_spec, which is used by LBaaSSpecHandler, so we can reuse the
function from utils instead of duplication of code.

Note that the passed k8s object is endpoint in case of
LoadBalancerHandler and service in case of LBaaSSpecHandler (but same
annotation used in both cases, so a common function should be enough)

Change-Id: I124109f79bcdefcc4948eb35b4bbb4a9ca87c43b
Signed-off-by: Yash Gupta <y.gupta@samsung.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 09:24:57.000000000', 'message': "Change OEM extensions architecture

This patch radically changes OEM extensions architecture in a
backward-incompatible manner. /o\

The rationale is that, prior to this change, it was impossible to
model non-leaf subresources in OEM subtree such as `Links` or
`Actions`. The reason is that OEM objects were lacking BMC connection
context to doing anything beyond just sitting on the parent resource
JSON they were once given.

Technically, this change rebases originally independent
`OEMExtensionResourceBase` class on top of universal `ResourceBase`
overriding its JSON parsing logic. That gives all the benefits and
features of `ResourceBase` implementation.

The other conceptual (and breaking!) change is that the OEM extension
should expose a callable that returns `OEMResourceBase` class, as
opposed to class instance as it used to be. Besides technical reasons
(preserving base class constructor signature), it seems that decoupling
implementation loader from initialization would give us more
flexibility going forward (e.g. sushy could sense what's being
exposed and initialize it differently).

Change-Id: I6c981bc1b2524d0a39a09ed8f0479b06045a1c4e
"}, {'created': '2019-08-16 09:41:06.000000000', 'message': "Change OEM extensions architecture

exposed and initialize it differently).

commit_message:
Change OEM extensions architecture

This patch radically changes OEM extensions architecture in a
backward-incompatible manner. /o\

The rationale is that, prior to this change, it was impossible to
model non-leaf subresources in OEM subtree such as `Links` or
`Actions`. The reason is that OEM objects were lacking BMC connection
context to doing anything beyond just sitting on the parent resource
JSON they were once given.

Technically, this change rebases originally base
`OEMExtensionResourceBase` class on top of universal `ResourceBase`
overriding its JSON parsing logic. That gives all the benefits and
features of `ResourceBase` implementation, including BMC connection
context, message registries etc.

The other conceptual (and breaking!) change is that the OEM extension
should now expose a callable that returns `OEMResourceBase` class, as
opposed to class instance as it used to be. Besides technical reasons
(preserving base class constructor signature), it seems that decoupling
implementation loader from initialization would give us more
flexibility going forward (e.g. sushy could sense what's being
exposed and initialize it differently).

Change-Id: I6c981bc1b2524d0a39a09ed8f0479b06045a1c4e
Story: 2006471
Task: 36402

subject: Split OSA Queens into two files for consistency
messages:
[{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-08-26 09:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-08-26 14:02:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Wow this is green!'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-27 15:02:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-08-29 09:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Devil's advocate here...

We do not allow to rewrite history and modify deliverables "composition" after they were released. Basically openstack-ansible 17.0.0 was released early 2018 and was made of this bunch of code repositories, and this is what appears on official websites like [1]. Here we are somehow rewriting history and now suddenly openstack-ansible 17.0.0 is a different thing.

I understand that in this case it probably does not matter that much (and users are unlikely to be confused) but that breaks the sacrosanct rule (once released, do not modify).

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/queens/index.html#openstack-ansible'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-29 09:51:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

We have had to do this in the past because of newer rules in our validation if there are some releases done for some of the deliverables in the file but not others.

That said, I haven't looked yet if that is the case here. But as long as it is just moving content and not actually modifying it, I believe it should be OK."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-29 09:51:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-08-30 11:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Devil's advocate here...
 > 
 > We do not allow to rewrite history and modify deliverables
 > "composition" after they were released. Basically openstack-ansible
 > 17.0.0 was released early 2018 and was made of this bunch of code
 > repositories, and this is what appears on official websites like
 > [1]. Here we are somehow rewriting history and now suddenly
 > openstack-ansible 17.0.0 is a different thing.
 > 
 > I understand that in this case it probably does not matter that
 > much (and users are unlikely to be confused) but that breaks the
 > sacrosanct rule (once released, do not modify).
 > 
 > [1] https://releases.openstack.org/queens/index.html#openstack-ansible

I understand your point. I kinda don't like it. But I find it a necessary evil to make the process of releasing OSA easier for new people.

Let me counter argumenting too, for the sake of the discussion :)

I believe that OpenStack-Ansible 17.0.0 we published (in the past) is the same as the one that shows up on the web page nowadays: The sha is the same. We are not retagging. The only thing that differs is the release website. For which people can still come back in history and see what used to be there, if necessary (which I seriously doubt) using releases' git repo.

When the openstack-ansible team (including an email to the ML) decided to not tag the roles anymore, that meant that releases for openstack-ansible would only list the "main" repository. That was decided to be applied on ALL branches, not the future ones. I expect the community to be aware of this, even if many didn't really care (they just care about the openstack-ansible repo, else we wouldn't have done all of this).

This patch merely brings consistency with the Queens branch (Rocky to be done afterwards).

I am fine with NOT bringing that in, it just makes the process more complex to teach to new people. I thought onboarding was more important.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-08-30 12:08:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

OK! Just wanted to call out the general rule and make sure that was considered an exception, rather than business as usual.

Since this is an exception, I'll let Sean as PTL with the last word on this."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-03 18:40:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 09:36:33.000000000', 'message': 'Split OSA Queens into two files for consistency

OSA Rocky and above splitted OSA and OSA roles into two
deliverable files. This was to accomodate the fact that, during
Rocky, we decided to make the roles tagless, only branched.

However, splitting the files into two has another advantage:
We could now release separately the roles and the main repository.

This is still useful to do for Queens, as we regularly create
queens releases, even if we don't tag them anymore (because
we decided to not apply tags for roles into ALL branches).

By splitting in two files, requesting a new-release with the
openstack-ansible deliverable will do just the minimum. We would
still be allowed to "tag" the roles for EM.

Change-Id: I14f4894b1676377d40b10e77429ddeef68d360ff
'}]
commit_message:
Split OSA Queens into two files for consistency

OSA Rocky and above splitted OSA and OSA roles into two
deliverable files. This was to accomodate the fact that, during
Rocky, we decided to make the roles tagless, only branched.

However, splitting the files into two has another advantage:
We could now release separately the roles and the main repository.

This is still useful to do for Queens, as we regularly create
queens releases, even if we don't tag them anymore (because
we decided to not apply tags for roles into ALL branches).

By splitting in two files, requesting a new-release with the
openstack-ansible deliverable will do just the minimum. We would
still be allowed to "tag" the roles for EM.

Change-Id: I14f4894b1676377d40b10e77429ddeef68d360ff

commit_message:
Include branch name in URL for IPA on master

While CoreOS images have a copy with and without the -master suffix,
tinyipa images which kayobe-config-dev has switched to, do not.

This change includes the branch name always.

https://tarballs.openstack.org/ironic-python-agent/coreos/files/

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Iff1504d17ecefd901d1c29c748a776a69a45b304

One question on the commit message.  I was able to get this to build after installing several latex packages on my ubuntu system.  Do we need to have any dependency checking for the Latex requirements?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-26 15:47:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Looks like we need to add latexmk to bindep and our development environment setup instructions. That latter could probably be done in a follow up.

Looks like also xelatex, though I can't find an individual package for that on Fedora 30:

Latexmk: Failure in processing file 'cinder.tex':
   (Pdf)LaTeX didn't generate the expected log file 'cinder.log'"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-26 15:56:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Fedora package name is texlive-xetex. That helped, but now got to a point where the job is waiting on stdin for some file name:

! LaTeX Error: File `cmap.sty' not found.
Type X to quit or <RETURN> to proceed,
or enter new name. (Default extension: sty)

Enter file name:"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-08-26 16:16:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Appropriate packages need to be installed to build a PDF file.

bindep.txt from patch set 2 (
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677301/2/bindep.txt ) would help you.

Perhaps the docs team need to document how to build a PDF file locally.'}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2019-08-26 17:09:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Looks like we need to add latexmk to bindep and our development environment setup instructions.

Copying bindep for PDF build is the thing the docs team tries to avoid.
That's the reason we install packages for PDF build through the zuul job.
stephenfin is thinking to provide some tooling to prepare the environment for PDF build. Until then, I think we can provide the instruction in some common place (etherpad now and then the documentation guide?)"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-26 17:46:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review Review-Priority+2

commit_message:
Add pdf documentation build in tox

This patch adds a new tox job/command for building the pdf version
of documentation.

tox -epdf-docs

In addition to adjusting the infra requirement for PDF build support,
the following changes are made to build a PDF doc.

- Inline sample config file is skipped for PDF doc
  to avoid an LaTeX error "TeX capacity exceeded".
- Download link of sample config and policy files are disabled
  for PDF doc as relative links do not make sense.
- "Search" and "genindex" page is only enabled for HTML doc
  as they work only for HTML doc.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ib8ce96f4d043dcf0cfe6d3f8b64879f07bc5958c

commit_message:
Fix python3 compatibility on LDAP search DN from id

In Python 3, python-ldap no longer allows bytes for some fields (DNs,
RDNs, attribute names, queries). Instead, text values are represented
as str, the Unicode text type.

[1] More details about byte/str usage in python-ldap can be found at:
http://www.python-ldap.org/en/latest/bytes_mode.html#bytes-mode

Change-Id: I63e3715032cd8edb11fbff7651f5ba1af506dc9d
Related-Bug: #1798184
(cherry picked from commit 03531a56910b12922afde32b40e270b7d68a334b)

commit_message:
Fixing dn_to_id function for cases were id is not in the DN

The more common scenario to return the uid as part of the RDN in a DN,
However, it's a valid case to not have the uid in the RDN, so we need to
search in the LDAP based on the DN and return the uid in the entire object.

Also, we do not support multivalued attribute id on DN, so the test case
covering this case, it was adjusted for raise NotFound.

Closes-Bug: 1782922
Change-Id: I87a3bfa94b5907ce4c6b4eb8e124ec948b390bf2
(cherry picked from commit a1dc21f3d34ae34bc6a5c9acebc0eb752495ae7a)

commit_message:
Add processing_hooks support in devstack

Allow ironic-inspector devstack to specify processing_hooks
in configuration, so as to be able to support non-default
hooks such as 'extra_hardware'.

Change-Id: I16c50d45eab2415854105117641bc7d9aca4dd22

commit_message:
overcloud status: return a message if no deployment is found

If "openstack overcloud status" has no deployment, returns a proper
message instead of just None.

Change-Id: Ia884a052223be31e8df9de8ae39dacd1fc3159cd
(cherry picked from commit 71135833d969f4b94c12ce5db8d57ccf7f0c34f1)

commit_message:
Nice to have test coverage for If1f465112b8e9b0304b8b5b864b985f72168d839

Matt pointed out in [1] that there is missing test coverage for some of
the changes in If1f465112b8e9b0304b8b5b864b985f72168d839 for the rpc api
behavior. So this follow up adds the extra unit tests.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655721/17/nova/compute/rpcapi.py@615

Change-Id: I5e837f30c888ed2fa63856670695d2836cf48e00

commit_message:
Add a test case for logging direct maps

I07643fbe3e1e712b7eac716a7f671a2d513e920b shows that keystone doesn't
properly log anything useful when debugging assertions and rules with
the ``keystone-manage mapping_engine --engine-debug`` tool.

This commit adds a test to ensure this behavior doesn't regress in the
future.

Change-Id: Id2e0e9821d68f57e215184bbf4d1f07c9bd1babf
Partial-Bug: 1841486

Previously the default ``certificates.available`` handler was
enabled without the charm authors intervention, this was changed
in I12f45236632b608e07fdd35d31b90b84ca92eb1f.

Change-Id: I4cbe72ce281cb36c6e2c7d9f745b21cd21623e56

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 22:52:28.000000000', 'message': 'fix missing shared_block for PF interface in switchdev bond connected to ovs

When having a deployment with ovs bridge having a linux bond and
the slaves of that bond are in switchdev mode , shared_blocks are
expected to be created for both the bond and the slaves, but because the
slaves have an autoconfig IPv6 so ovs will assume that the slaves are not
managed by it, and so those shared_blocks will be missing for those slaves.

As a workaround for this issue we should handle two cases:
 * First os-net-config run / Post deployment
 * Reboot compute node

For deployment case, we are restarting openvswitch and ifdown ifup
any PF interface, this will make openvswitch recreate PF shared_block

For reboot case, we are disabling ipv6 for PF interfaces and because
the ovs will start after moving to swichdev, so the shared_blocks will
be created.

Also there is no need to ifup the PF interfaces after moving to switchdev
in reboot case as the config scripts will bring them up later

Change-Id: I2468866629d95dc9f088985d57fbf70263253235
Closes-Bug: #1836581
(cherry picked from commit a74bbdd7b017fb3bb9faffb4240efa59cb42c79c)
'}]
commit_message:
fix missing shared_block for PF interface in switchdev bond connected to ovs

When having a deployment with ovs bridge having a linux bond and
the slaves of that bond are in switchdev mode , shared_blocks are
expected to be created for both the bond and the slaves, but because the
slaves have an autoconfig IPv6 so ovs will assume that the slaves are not
managed by it, and so those shared_blocks will be missing for those slaves.

As a workaround for this issue we should handle two cases:
 * First os-net-config run / Post deployment
 * Reboot compute node

For deployment case, we are restarting openvswitch and ifdown ifup
any PF interface, this will make openvswitch recreate PF shared_block

For reboot case, we are disabling ipv6 for PF interfaces and because
the ovs will start after moving to swichdev, so the shared_blocks will
be created.

Also there is no need to ifup the PF interfaces after moving to switchdev
in reboot case as the config scripts will bring them up later

Change-Id: I2468866629d95dc9f088985d57fbf70263253235
Closes-Bug: #1836581
(cherry picked from commit a74bbdd7b017fb3bb9faffb4240efa59cb42c79c)

commit_message:
libvirt: Start checking compute usage in functional tests

We're using placement. Let's make sure everything is working in concert
and requesting the right amount and types of things.

Change-Id: Ieea576b700327ba5a5300e512d42e51a255abbba
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Bhagyashri Shewale <bhagyashri.shewale@nttdata.com>

[{'created': '2019-08-30 03:53:55.000000000', 'message': "Fix fujitsu's wrong call to pywbem

Long integers incorrectly call pywbem.Uint8() due to design flaws.
ValueError will appear in versions with pywbem greater than 0.7.
This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I490baad119c4c0a11af37d7e84a4c344f0ab5a1b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix fujitsu's wrong call to pywbem

Long integers incorrectly call pywbem.Uint8() due to design flaws.
ValueError will appear in versions with pywbem greater than 0.7.
This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I490baad119c4c0a11af37d7e84a4c344f0ab5a1b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 22:52:12.000000000', 'message': 'fix missing shared_block for PF interface in switchdev bond connected to ovs

When having a deployment with ovs bridge having a linux bond and
the slaves of that bond are in switchdev mode , shared_blocks are
expected to be created for both the bond and the slaves, but because the
slaves have an autoconfig IPv6 so ovs will assume that the slaves are not
managed by it, and so those shared_blocks will be missing for those slaves.

As a workaround for this issue we should handle two cases:
 * First os-net-config run / Post deployment
 * Reboot compute node

For deployment case, we are restarting openvswitch and ifdown ifup
any PF interface, this will make openvswitch recreate PF shared_block

For reboot case, we are disabling ipv6 for PF interfaces and because
the ovs will start after moving to swichdev, so the shared_blocks will
be created.

Also there is no need to ifup the PF interfaces after moving to switchdev
in reboot case as the config scripts will bring them up later

Change-Id: I2468866629d95dc9f088985d57fbf70263253235
Closes-Bug: #1836581
(cherry picked from commit a74bbdd7b017fb3bb9faffb4240efa59cb42c79c)
'}]
commit_message:
fix missing shared_block for PF interface in switchdev bond connected to ovs

When having a deployment with ovs bridge having a linux bond and
the slaves of that bond are in switchdev mode , shared_blocks are
expected to be created for both the bond and the slaves, but because the
slaves have an autoconfig IPv6 so ovs will assume that the slaves are not
managed by it, and so those shared_blocks will be missing for those slaves.

As a workaround for this issue we should handle two cases:
 * First os-net-config run / Post deployment
 * Reboot compute node

For deployment case, we are restarting openvswitch and ifdown ifup
any PF interface, this will make openvswitch recreate PF shared_block

For reboot case, we are disabling ipv6 for PF interfaces and because
the ovs will start after moving to swichdev, so the shared_blocks will
be created.

Also there is no need to ifup the PF interfaces after moving to switchdev
in reboot case as the config scripts will bring them up later

Change-Id: I2468866629d95dc9f088985d57fbf70263253235
Closes-Bug: #1836581
(cherry picked from commit a74bbdd7b017fb3bb9faffb4240efa59cb42c79c)

commit_message:
libvirt: Simplify 'fakelibvirt.HostInfo' object

Nothing was overriding a number of these fields so make things less
complex by removing the customizability. We can easily re-add it if we
need to in the future. We can do more here (most callers of this use the
exact same values), but that's a change for later.

Change-Id: Id3e0668acb71b3c7350b73b4afff7e940c6dfb1d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Cisco FC Zone Manager Driver - Python3.x support

In Python 2.x, filter method returns an actual list
whereas in 3.x it will be an iterable obj which is not handled
properly in existing cisco zone driver code.

Change-Id: I561f18b4478047ef431078a965048f908b2e22b9
Signed-off-by: = Akhil Jayakumar akjayaku@cisco.com

commit_message:
Infortrend: Mock sleep in tests

Mock sleep in tests.  This shaves 12+ seconds
off of a unit test run.

Remove some redundant code.

Change-Id: I724ed3b8f4eaf5e192d41b8752e8df297499e746

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Fix for CI on replication_device config

Change variable initializations from None to [] where replication_device is
not set in cinder.conf.

Change-Id: I6d096432c8d71aa02ca56f545dd2c72f22ac9fda

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-29 08:18:44.000000000', 'message': 'Increase number of retries in _process_trunk_subport_bindings

In patch [1] as partial fix for bug 1828375 retries mechanism
was proposed.
We noticed that sometimes in have loaded environments 3 retries
defined in [1] can be not enough.
So this patch switches to use neutron_lib.db.api.MAX_RETRIES constant
as number of retries when processing trunk subport bindings.
This MAX_RETRIES constant is set to 20 and in our cases it "fixed"
problem.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662236/

Change-Id: I016ef3d7ccbb89b68d4a3d509162b3046a9c2f98
Related-Bug: #1828375
(cherry picked from commit d1f8888843c53c1c4b95c2fd22b2b6ee97feb238)
'}]
commit_message:
Increase number of retries in _process_trunk_subport_bindings

In patch [1] as partial fix for bug 1828375 retries mechanism
was proposed.
We noticed that sometimes in have loaded environments 3 retries
defined in [1] can be not enough.
So this patch switches to use neutron_lib.db.api.MAX_RETRIES constant
as number of retries when processing trunk subport bindings.
This MAX_RETRIES constant is set to 20 and in our cases it "fixed"
problem.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662236/

Change-Id: I016ef3d7ccbb89b68d4a3d509162b3046a9c2f98
Related-Bug: #1828375
(cherry picked from commit d1f8888843c53c1c4b95c2fd22b2b6ee97feb238)

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Update some URLs to latest
3. Remove unncessary "=="

Change-Id: Iff24e8d5082d8ef8dc2d29ea92288bf418f5500d

Update drivers documentation

at the 7 August weekly cinder meeting.

commit_message:
Negative tests for testing actions with node-get command

Negative test for the Ironic CLI commands which checks actions with
node command like use commands without arguments or with
incorrect arguments and check that correct error message raised.

Closes-Bug: #1610982
Change-Id: I72ba086a080389acbda0632b5c466dfd67cb2db0

commit_message:
Migrate the functional job to Zuul v3

- rename it so that it follows the documented pattern
  (<project>-<specifier>);
- remove the old job, including the hooks, hoping that no
  3rd-party CI uses them.

Change-Id: Ib690c4fa96354dc422576d76c1296b1d5ba3494d

[{'created': '2019-08-30 14:49:16.000000000', 'message': 'Prepare for deprecation of iscsi_verify_attempts in ironic-lib

ironic-lib itself is not concerned with iscsi deploy, and this option
is actually used for partition detection retry count. This is
confusing, so this patch moves the option to ironic.

Change-Id: Idacf9b576173f878475a4b7e1503109095dafcd0
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for deprecation of iscsi_verify_attempts in ironic-lib

ironic-lib itself is not concerned with iscsi deploy, and this option
is actually used for partition detection retry count. This is
confusing, so this patch moves the option to ironic.

Change-Id: Idacf9b576173f878475a4b7e1503109095dafcd0

commit_message:
use standard_attr db from neutron-lib

This patch consumes the neutron_lib.db.standard_attr module from
neutron-lib by switching all imports to use neutron-lib's standard_attr.

Change-Id: I846d99918aac6ae3dc699ed06233b1f4fa5ea78b

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I6596739f10292d3953834d56c24de380d405b90b

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I910d0c00d4ff55b183a4b800c5710924d359c612

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I306adef1efe667966ad502177c3efc317b16e911

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

Change-Id: I128f18d83a950b31e1e8c5a475d6e21a1987242f

commit_message:
py3: encode messages on py3

On python3 send fails with TypeError: a bytes-like object is required,
not 'str', this patch solves this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1820154
Change-Id: I700462a9a5bcc66b2edf05e4e0396556e381a8c1

commit_message:
Use secure websocket for nova serial console proxy when TLS enabled

This resolves an issue where the web browser would complain that it
was trying to connect to insecure websocket when using HTTPS with
horizon.

Change-Id: Ib75cc2bc1b3811bc31badd5fda3db3ed0c59b119
Closes-Bug: #1841914
(cherry picked from commit 94d824dd0eec3f1a37586c03d0b79b074c37653e)

commit_message:
Clarify the NOTE associated with ordering of middleware

WSGI middleware is a confusing topic for people who are not
familiar with it, so make the NOTE that describes how the
ordering works more clear.

Change-Id: I21680298f98f83d47e8319f01ad714cd96418c26

subject: Merge request log and request id middlewares
messages:
[{'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-16 16:21:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-17 10:01:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Comparing logs in the tempest tests here and in something else, it looks like the first time you do a LOG it finds the current context and keeps that for the rest of time, and thus user and project info don't get in the logs.

So in the auth.py where we generate a context we probably need to figure out how to get the current one and add to it, instead of creating a new one."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-20 19:35:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

This is working. You can track a request ID req-ab96ddab-baee-4a6a-b538-a5b713fa4c93 from the scheduler [1] back and forth to placement [2], where it does the sequence from GET /a_c through to PUT /allocations and a final GET /allocations.

(Now if we could only get the nova services sending the proper *global* request_id through to each other -- as you can see from [1], it's the local request_id that's being sent down to placement.)

> So in the auth.py where we generate a context we probably need to figure out how to get the current one and add to it, instead of creating a new one.

Use oslo_context.context.get_current() to get the RequestContext saved in threadlocal.

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/a6feb2564e834f4db639cd1960a99223/log/controller/logs/screen-n-sch.txt.gz#937
[2] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/a6feb2564e834f4db639cd1960a99223/log/controller/logs/screen-placement-api.txt.gz#416"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-27 10:45:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

will tune up the context'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-27 11:48:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow

It seems I was wrong when I was looking at the tempest logs last week.

The stuff for a single request is correct:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/a6feb2564e834f4db639cd1960a99223/log/controller/logs/screen-placement-api.txt.gz#310-318

start with global and local req id, but no auth info, then once auth info is present start using it, with correct req ids

Eric, how should we integrate this with your changes? If at all? Maybe just kill yours and rebase my doc changes on this one?'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-28 09:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-28 21:08:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Eric, how should we integrate this with your changes? If at all? Maybe just kill yours

yes'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-09-03 10:54:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

The duplication is not ideal but I have not better idea without changing oslo.middleware.

gibi'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 16:21:18.000000000', 'message': 'Merge request log and request id middlewares

This is done to ensure that both are in the outermost
piece of middleware so that we generate and log the
global request id (if any) as early as possible, and
use it, and the local request id, throughout the entire
middleware stack.

This turned out to be somewhat more complex than desired
because:

* The request id middleware from oslo_middleware is a webob
  wsgi app, so we need to map the request log middleware to
  that style (meaning more changes than strictly necessary).

* The __call__ in the request id middleware is not composed
  to make calling it as a super clean, so instead of doing that
  we are copying code. Which implies some risks for which we
  may wish to consider workarounds.

This is an alternative to I5a80056dd88836a4e79a649fa02d36dc7e75eee4

Change-Id: I7e24b54bfcd296f13ea4f65dbb10ba63679c05b1
'}, {'created': '2019-08-28 09:00:23.000000000', 'message': 'Merge request log and request id middlewares

This is done to ensure that both are in the outermost
piece of middleware so that we generate and log the
global request id (if any) as early as possible, and
use it, and the local request id, throughout the entire
middleware stack.

This turned out to be somewhat more complex than desired
because:

* The request id middleware from oslo_middleware is a webob
  wsgi app, so we need to map the request log middleware to
  that style (meaning more changes than strictly necessary).

* The __call__ in the request id middleware is not composed
  to make calling it as a super clean, so instead of doing that
  we are copying code. Which implies some risks for which we
  may wish to consider workarounds.

This is an alternative to I5a80056dd88836a4e79a649fa02d36dc7e75eee4

Change-Id: I7e24b54bfcd296f13ea4f65dbb10ba63679c05b1
'}]
commit_message:
Merge request log and request id middlewares

This is done to ensure that both are in the outermost
piece of middleware so that we generate and log the
global request id (if any) as early as possible, and
use it, and the local request id, throughout the entire
middleware stack.

This turned out to be somewhat more complex than desired
because:

* The request id middleware from oslo_middleware is a webob
  wsgi app, so we need to map the request log middleware to
  that style (meaning more changes than strictly necessary).

* The __call__ in the request id middleware is not composed
  to make calling it as a super clean, so instead of doing that
  we are copying code. Which implies some risks for which we
  may wish to consider workarounds.

This is an alternative to I5a80056dd88836a4e79a649fa02d36dc7e75eee4

Change-Id: I7e24b54bfcd296f13ea4f65dbb10ba63679c05b1

commit_message:
Use net_default_mac in ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic_pxe_uefi.default.j2

Upstream ironic went from $net_default_ip to $net_default_mac in
ironic/drivers/modules/master_grub_cfg.txt with
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/578959/

This commit makes the same change for
ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic_pxe_uefi.default.j2

Using $net_default_ip breaks ironic standalone deployments with
[dhcp]dhcp_provider = none

Change-Id: I2ca9a66d2bdb0aab5cd9936c8be8206e6ade3bd5
Closes-Bug: 1842078
(cherry picked from commit 870cb1beb229d6f856da4c974ca7e73d3d89d56d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-31 05:30:02.000000000', 'message': "Split API and conductor services

This patch splits API and conductor services for ironic-inspector.
Previous patch utilized lock from tooz coordinator, this patch adds
a coordinator wrapper for easier usage and further introduces group
interfaces.

Each conductor service will join a predefined group to mark it's
availability, on each request, API service will query members from
the group and randomly choose on of them, create desiginated topic
and deliver request to it.

The feature is tested with the memcached and file backend of tooz,
etcd3 backend is not working currently, due to unknown reason the
python-etcd3 client cannot refresh membership lease. This makes
ironic inspector unable to utilize the member management with ttl.

Story: 2001842
Task: 30376

Change-Id: I419176cd6d44d74c066db275ef008fe8bb6ef37a

availability, on each request, API service will query members from
the group and randomly choose on of them, create desiginated topic
and deliver request to it.

The feature is tested with the memcached, file and etcd3gw backend
of tooz. Other backends are not tested but  may work as well, please
refer to tooz documentation for driver compatibilities[1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tooz/latest/user/compatibility.html

commit_message:
Split API and conductor services

This patch splits API and conductor services for ironic-inspector.
Previous patch utilized lock from tooz coordinator, this patch adds
a coordinator wrapper for easier usage and further introduces group
interfaces.

Each conductor service will join a predefined group to mark it's
availability, on each request, API service will query members from
the group and randomly choose on of them, create desiginated topic
and deliver request to it.

The feature is tested with the memcached, file backend of tooz.
Other backends are not fully tested but may work as well, please
refer to tooz documentation for driver compatibilities[1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tooz/latest/user/compatibility.html

Story: 2001842
Task: 30376

Change-Id: I419176cd6d44d74c066db275ef008fe8bb6ef37a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 15:28:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add request_spec to server move RPC calls

To be able to fill the allocation key in the port binding:profile during
the move operations the nova-compute needs to get the RequestSpec object
to have access to the port - resource provider mapping calculated in the
conductor.

This patch bumps the compute RPC api version and adds a new request_spec
parameter to multiple calls. Also it makes sure that the request_spec is
passed by the sender.

Change-Id: If1f465112b8e9b0304b8b5b864b985f72168d839
blueprint: support-server-move-operations-with-ports-having-resource-request
'}, {'created': '2019-04-29 23:11:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add request_spec to server move RPC calls

commit_message:
Add request_spec to server move RPC calls

To be able to fill the allocation key in the port binding:profile during
the move operations the nova-compute needs to get the RequestSpec object
to have access to the port - resource provider mapping calculated in the
conductor.

This patch bumps the compute RPC api version and adds a new request_spec
parameter to multiple calls. Also it makes sure that the request_spec is
passed by the sender.

Change-Id: If1f465112b8e9b0304b8b5b864b985f72168d839
blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

commit_message:
Make rally jobs use the latest ODL versions

Change flourine rally job to sodium and oxygen to neon, as those are the
latest ODL versions. Add these versions to devstack settings and
odl-releases. General spring cleaning otherwise.

Change-Id: I9245f22c12dc41801323b02f42d2c7d2b8905a80

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-10 15:22:14.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] DPDK in baremetal containers using SR-IOV

This commit allows to use DKDP applications in
k8s pods.

SR-IOV binding driver now can get information
by kubelet resourse client and compute appropriate
pci device.

To use DPDK applications inside the container
SR-IOV binding driver binds used device on apropriate
driver.

Change-Id: I30ba1f30ae69562a91314fc2f14eba98b1692450
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>

commit_message:
DPDK in baremetal containers using SR-IOV

This commit allows to use DPDK applications in
k8s pods.

To use DPDK applications inside the container
SR-IOV binding driver binds used device on apropriate
driver that is specified in config.

Partially implements: bp dpdk-applications-in-containers
Change-Id: I30ba1f30ae69562a91314fc2f14eba98b1692450
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>

 > than specific assert.

As [1], assertEqual can do everything which specific one did.
Also make our test cases cleaner.
As [2], not to call the specific one is recommended.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 04:16:32.000000000', 'message': 'test: Use assertEqual() instead of assertXXXEqual()

As [1], assertEqual will automatically use type-specific methods,
such as assertDictEqual.
it’s usually not necessary to invoke these methods directly.
assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dict, list,
set and so on. So we just call assertEqual() to make
the unit tests simpler.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#type-specific-methods

Change-Id: I42c077a543fca86b18659899d7ec0fc1f9a2bd78
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>
'}, {'created': '2018-01-26 02:19:06.000000000', 'message': 'test: Use assertEqual() instead of assertXXXEqual()

As [1], assertEqual will automatically use type-specific methods,
such as assertDictEqual.
it’s usually not necessary to invoke these methods directly.
assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dict, list,
set and so on. So we just call assertEqual() to make
the unit tests simpler.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#type-specific-methods

Change-Id: I42c077a543fca86b18659899d7ec0fc1f9a2bd78
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>
'}]
commit_message:
test: Use assertEqual() instead of assertXXXEqual()

As [1], assertEqual will automatically use type-specific methods,
such as assertDictEqual.
it’s usually not necessary to invoke these methods directly.
assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dict, list,
set and so on. So we just call assertEqual() to make
the unit tests simpler.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#type-specific-methods

Change-Id: I42c077a543fca86b18659899d7ec0fc1f9a2bd78
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 01:53:28.000000000', 'message': 'Generate static ARA report when necessary

OpenStack CI recently switched to object based log storage, which
cannot render ARA sqlite databases since there is no longer middleware
to do so. The Zuul inventory contains a var that allows us to detect
this situation called "ara_report_type". In the openstack gate, this
var is set to "html", indicating a static report should be generated.

We will now use this var in the log collection playbook to indicate
to that our log collect script should generate an ARA static html
report.

Change-Id: I74ba6ab2ee329e3c78b470152c7f279fc34e1eb9
(cherry picked from commit e97e32126419a86d3f4dd9becd0d4d4029a0c7b7)
'}]
commit_message:
Generate static ARA report when necessary

OpenStack CI recently switched to object based log storage, which
cannot render ARA sqlite databases since there is no longer middleware
to do so. The Zuul inventory contains a var that allows us to detect
this situation called "ara_report_type". In the openstack gate, this
var is set to "html", indicating a static report should be generated.

We will now use this var in the log collection playbook to indicate
to that our log collect script should generate an ARA static html
report.

Change-Id: I74ba6ab2ee329e3c78b470152c7f279fc34e1eb9
(cherry picked from commit e97e32126419a86d3f4dd9becd0d4d4029a0c7b7)

[{'account_id': 30881, 'date': '2019-08-26 11:51:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-08-26 11:51:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2019-08-26 14:29:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Backport-Candidate+1 Code-Review+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 11:51:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix template that generates vrrp check script

Correct the inline comment to not include an empty new line at the start
of generated /var/lib/octavia/vrrp/check_script.sh that leads to this
kind of error:

>  Aug 26 11:49:32 amphora-12184e15-1ec3-4d80-98a7-c7d1ddb6716f
> Keepalived_vrrp[15265]: Error exec-ing command
> '/var/lib/octavia/vrrp/check_script.sh', error 8: Exec format error

Change-Id: Icddd2873abeb56a389a35356995df6dde70872b2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix template that generates vrrp check script

Correct the inline comment to not include an empty new line at the start
of generated /var/lib/octavia/vrrp/check_script.sh that leads to this
kind of error:

>  Aug 26 11:49:32 amphora-12184e15-1ec3-4d80-98a7-c7d1ddb6716f
> Keepalived_vrrp[15265]: Error exec-ing command
> '/var/lib/octavia/vrrp/check_script.sh', error 8: Exec format error

Change-Id: Icddd2873abeb56a389a35356995df6dde70872b2

(3 comments)

Looking at the test results, it looks like the live migration tests didn't even run:

https://storage.bhs1.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/logs_87/678887/6/check/nova-live-migration/d3d4357/ara-report/result/092050bb-201e-4657-ac3f-16aebd4578ff/

You can see it start executing run_tests stuff here:

2019-08-28 04:37:56.230 | 1. test with all local storage (use default for volumes)
2019-08-28 04:37:56.232 | NOTE: test_volume_backed_live_migration is skipped due to https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1524898
2019-08-28 04:37:57.817 | Missing value auth-url required for auth plugin password

But then it switches to test_evacuate.sh:

2019-08-28 04:37:57.909 | + environment:post_test_hook:L1:   /opt/stack/new/nova/gate/test_evacuate.sh

So I wonder if something failed with the new code lines. We probably lost the set -xe because of the sourced scripts losing the trace value."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-08-28 14:58:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

artom for what its worth i decied to write a custom job to test this.
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652197/


the first set of test results were promising

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/4778ebe053804dbb976917fd40c1a860

https://d14c0e495b00eea27855-0acfe5e696fda6aec28b6c718c3c4841.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/679656/2/check/tempest-nfv-multi-numa-multinode/4778ebe/testr_results.html.gz

i did not have many tests enabled but all but one of them suceeded

i notices that i had remvoed some setting form the compute node that were required so that is why the cold migration job test failed


i have enabled the live migration tests and some other and its currently re running.

we should get new results in an hour or so.

with all that said your off today so dont worry about this untill tomorow :)'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-09-02 18:47:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

commit_message:
DNM: Run LM integration tests with NUMA flavor

The dependency tree is weird, but I just wanted to uncouple the DNM
patches from the NUMA LM series, so I made the DNM nova job depend on
the DNM devstack change, which depends on the NUMA LM series.

Change-Id: I8630786be069c0341962dbd7382d316d1b2ccb6f
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679319/
