commit_message:
Publish blazar-tempest-plugin documentation

There are installation and usage docs, but they are not published at
http://docs.openstack.org. Add the required job to publish them.

Change-Id: I1a68a42ee5eee45162565cca6bd3b1790e687296

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-25 14:14:37.000000000', 'message': 'Hardcode the names of the default NGs

As decided, the names of the default NGs should follow the convention
"default-<role>". This change fixes the migration responsible for
populating the default nodegroups.

Change-Id: I7a3ea4c14e1353a02ed91cfe47f89e2b00d802a1
Story: 2005953
Task: 34318
'}]
commit_message:
Hardcode the names of the default NGs

As decided, the names of the default NGs should follow the convention
"default-<role>". This change fixes the migration responsible for
populating the default nodegroups.

Change-Id: I7a3ea4c14e1353a02ed91cfe47f89e2b00d802a1
Story: 2005953
Task: 34318

subject: Modified step 3 "Enable the VirtIO drivers"
messages:
[{'account_id': 30658, 'date': '2019-07-07 17:16:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-07-07 17:16:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-07-07 18:23:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The command "tox -e docs" to build the document failed with several
errors with the following messages:

  doc/source/contributing.rst:4:Problems with "include" directive path:

Change-Id: I6fc144881a1a92ae44e2ff5b5be9c3c5de005523

errors with the following messages:

  doc/source/contributing.rst:4:Problems with "include" directive path:
  InputError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '../CONTRIBUTING.rst'.

This patch fixes it to successfully build documentation.

Change-Id: I6fc144881a1a92ae44e2ff5b5be9c3c5de005523
'}]
commit_message:
Fix failures when building documentation

The command "tox -e docs" to build documentation failed with several
errors with the following messages:

  doc/source/contributing.rst:4:Problems with "include" directive path:
  InputError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '../CONTRIBUTING.rst'.

  doc/source/usage.rst:document isn't included in any toctree

This patch fixes it to successfully build documentation.

Change-Id: I6fc144881a1a92ae44e2ff5b5be9c3c5de005523

commit_message:
Take kubeproxy_options into account on proxy setup

The label kubeproxy_options was being ignored when setting up both
master and minions. Add it to the kube proxy args.

Change-Id: Ic830f19e1af062e90d066e6df4df2e4376e4f379
Story: 2006465
Task: 36394

commit_message:
[fedora-atomic][k8s] Fix missing internal IP

This is a missing case after we fixed[1]. When user passing in
an existing network when creating cluster, the network name is
missed in the code. This patch fixes it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/678067

Task: 36430
Story: 2005333

Change-Id: I3a005089c4a755812c40589d8fa1e3ab7bbf062d

commit_message:
Using vxlan as default value for flannel_backend

Flannel is recommending using vxlan[1] and udp is just for debugging
or the kernel doesn't support vxlan or host-gw. So this patch is
proposing using 'vxlan' as the default value of label 'flannel_backend'
and it has been verified with sonobuoy.

[1] https://github.com/coreos/flannel/blob/master/Documentation/backends.md

Task: 36425
Story: 2006482

Change-Id: Ibe7f3446be894c593c6147186cc159bd01834d29

commit_message:
tempest: Move to tempest and convert to python3

The name of tempest starts with a lowercase "t" so move the file to
openstack/tempest/tempest.spec.j2 . Also switch to python3.

Change-Id: Ib4c7127b2a0dae3cb35ecd58161990826d199410

subject: OSH: Add release management method
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1004, 'name': 'Mohammed Naser', 'email': 'mnaser@vexxhost.com', 'username': 'mnaser'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 10607, 'name': 'Alexandra Settle', 'email': 'a.settle@outlook.com', 'username': 'asettle'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2019-07-26 17:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-07-26 17:27:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Looks fine to me from the release perspective.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-07-26 17:32:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-07-26 17:33:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Rollcall-Vote

I should probably wait for Tony to chime in as releases PTL before I vote formally, but this looks OK to me.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-07-26 17:33:07.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from osh-release-model to project-update'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-07-26 17:33:32.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from project-update to release-management'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-07-29 00:29:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-07-29 12:24:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1 Code-Review-1

I thought the release-management: item in governance was only to mark none, external, or deprecated (i.e. where the release-management happens in governance perspective -- external vs internal).

So here, either OSH wants to not follow releases (and should explain why the process isn't interesting for them, by submitting a patch with release-management: none), or they are following the current process (so no need for this "independent" flag here).

To my knowlege, I would say that OSH is currently planning to follow the normal governance rules, but simply intends to be independently released. In that case, something should be done in releases repo.

I am against the addition of this "independent" into reference/projects until it's announced on the ML, and then we remove the equivalent information in releases.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-07-30 15:37:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

Agree with JP, that's duplicating information.

What we care about in the governance repo is just whether the RelMgt team is handling the releases for that deliverable. By default the RelMgt team is handling releases for all official OpenStack things, and we record exceptions (none, external, deprecated) here. 

For deliverables handled by the RelMgt team, we record the release model they follow in the releases repository. I'd rather not duplicate that info here."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-07-30 15:40:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If we really want to "record" the release model picked for OSH before their first release happens, I'd recommend adding a boilerplate file to the deliverables/_independent directory in the releases repository.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-08-16 14:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can we get some traction / updates on this?'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-16 14:34:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Rollcall-Vote'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-08-26 06:32:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think this simply needs to be abandoned.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-26 14:00:44.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+1 by Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-08-29 11:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes this is incorrect and should be abandoned.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-09-03 09:35:58.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning due to inactivity from the owner. If concern is raised, please reopen and discuss. 

Thanks.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-26 17:19:58.000000000', 'message': 'OSH: Add release management method

This PS adds the release management method for OSH, which as an
openstack lcm tool intends to release on a sperate cycle and
versioning strategy from the projects it can orchestrate.

Change-Id: I9d7bd07c56e0527298eb8333bd066e0fcac40f4e
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>
'}]
commit_message:
OSH: Add release management method

This PS adds the release management method for OSH, which as an
openstack lcm tool intends to release on a sperate cycle and
versioning strategy from the projects it can orchestrate.

Change-Id: I9d7bd07c56e0527298eb8333bd066e0fcac40f4e
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

subject: Don't recursively modify file perms on start
messages:
[{'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2019-09-03 04:10:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2019-09-03 06:43:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think globally removing recurse is a good idea.

Log files in particular are very important to keep writable by the service: it can be hard to debug a service that doesn't start because it cannot write to its log file."}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2019-09-03 06:57:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2019-09-03 06:57:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2019-09-03 07:35:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-09-03 08:37:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I don't think globally removing recurse is a good idea.
 > 
 > Log files in particular are very important to keep writable by the
 > service: it can be hard to debug a service that doesn't start
 > because it cannot write to its log file.

+1 for needing some care here. It should be fine to remove recurse from empty directories, but there may be places where we have files in the container image that we want to change the ownership of on startup."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-09-03 09:03:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

+1 for rethinking approach'}]

commit_message:
Delete default gnocchi & aodh wsgi conf in Ubuntu binary

Ubuntu distro package will create default wsgi conf in apache
during gnocchi-api and aodh-api installation. We need to delete
them since we only use the conf that pushed by kolla-ansible.

Change-Id: Ib31e733eba12deebdf469c306dfba4191a1b89f5
Related-Bug: 1832306
Related-Bug: 1836520
(cherry picked from commit 5eb780d0b0d12186c57b828320c3421b98b97840)
(cherry picked from commit cc6694dbc8907bad5085f9129fccd5b682e72b66)

commit_message:
Translate tempest to openstack-tempest

We currently have Tempest (uppercase T) but the pypi name is really
tempest (lowercase t).
So support both (upper/lower case) for now.

Change-Id: I0b74f9f79a8610d23912334310f148f2915f3f4d

Bump lower constraint of python-zunclient

Projects that depends on python-zunclient should use the latest
version as lower constraint.

commit_message:
Exit listing validations with a proper return code

When listing validations through the CLI, the return code was always 0.

This patch adds a proper return code management to validations listing
CLI by raising an exception.

Change-Id: I3171adabc639789b0ea805a140e4b1220ed4c93a
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

subject: fix missing shared_block for PF interface in switchdev bond connected to ovs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 12171, 'name': 'Moshe Levi', 'email': 'moshele@nvidia.com', 'username': 'moshele'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 16690, 'name': 'Noam Angel', 'email': 'noama@nvidia.com', 'username': 'noama'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28714, 'name': 'Adrian Chiris', 'email': 'adrianc@nvidia.com', 'username': 'adrianc'}]
messages: [{'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2019-08-30 22:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2019-08-30 22:52:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit e1b03386e5f24091664dfdff9cbd9ac5296375d1'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2019-09-03 04:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 22:51:50.000000000', 'message': 'fix missing shared_block for PF interface in switchdev bond connected to ovs

When having a deployment with ovs bridge having a linux bond and
the slaves of that bond are in switchdev mode , shared_blocks are
expected to be created for both the bond and the slaves, but because the
slaves have an autoconfig IPv6 so ovs will assume that the slaves are not
managed by it, and so those shared_blocks will be missing for those slaves.

As a workaround for this issue we should handle two cases:
 * First os-net-config run / Post deployment
 * Reboot compute node

For deployment case, we are restarting openvswitch and ifdown ifup
any PF interface, this will make openvswitch recreate PF shared_block

For reboot case, we are disabling ipv6 for PF interfaces and because
the ovs will start after moving to swichdev, so the shared_blocks will
be created.

Also there is no need to ifup the PF interfaces after moving to switchdev
in reboot case as the config scripts will bring them up later

Change-Id: I2468866629d95dc9f088985d57fbf70263253235
Closes-Bug: #1836581
(cherry picked from commit a74bbdd7b017fb3bb9faffb4240efa59cb42c79c)
'}]
commit_message:
fix missing shared_block for PF interface in switchdev bond connected to ovs

When having a deployment with ovs bridge having a linux bond and
the slaves of that bond are in switchdev mode , shared_blocks are
expected to be created for both the bond and the slaves, but because the
slaves have an autoconfig IPv6 so ovs will assume that the slaves are not
managed by it, and so those shared_blocks will be missing for those slaves.

As a workaround for this issue we should handle two cases:
 * First os-net-config run / Post deployment
 * Reboot compute node

For deployment case, we are restarting openvswitch and ifdown ifup
any PF interface, this will make openvswitch recreate PF shared_block

For reboot case, we are disabling ipv6 for PF interfaces and because
the ovs will start after moving to swichdev, so the shared_blocks will
be created.

Also there is no need to ifup the PF interfaces after moving to switchdev
in reboot case as the config scripts will bring them up later

Change-Id: I2468866629d95dc9f088985d57fbf70263253235
Closes-Bug: #1836581
(cherry picked from commit a74bbdd7b017fb3bb9faffb4240efa59cb42c79c)

commit_message:
Move TLS related helpers to ``OpenStackCharm`` base class

TLS configuration is applicable to non-API services too.

Retains compability with the existing usage pattern by extending
the helpers with current defaults in the ``HAOpenStackCharm``
class.

Deprecates references to the Keystone interface as a source of
certificate data.  This has been removed from the Keystone charm:
openstack/charm-keystone/commit/17b24e7fde8e4c8c276a4f392cbae0d1d0ed2615

Reactive handling counterparts:
Depends-On: I007275c041ca5465664a6b5d441e56c0316c405d
Depends-On: I12f45236632b608e07fdd35d31b90b84ca92eb1f

Change-Id: I8a72acd451dd21e1b042b7f71f6d98e164737ac1
Closes-Bug: #1840899

commit_message:
Remove TLS related helpers

We will add these further up the stack in ``layer-openstack``,
addition counterpart: I12f45236632b608e07fdd35d31b90b84ca92eb1f

Make some adjustments so the build job used solemnly for gate
testing can pass again.

Needed-By: I8a72acd451dd21e1b042b7f71f6d98e164737ac1
Depends-On: I12f45236632b608e07fdd35d31b90b84ca92eb1f
Closes-Bug: #1840899
Change-Id: I007275c041ca5465664a6b5d441e56c0316c405d

commit_message:
Extend NeutronFixture to handle migrations

To be able to properly test migrations NeutronFixture needs to
handle neutronv2.api.API.migrate_instance_finish which is mocked today.

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

Change-Id: Ifbefad6297cf0c46d23871204cede0deed9ff5c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 15:40:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add default certificates relation handlers

These where moved up to this layer from ``layer-openstack-api``,
removal counterpart: I007275c041ca5465664a6b5d441e56c0316c405d

We do not add back ``layer-tls-client``, the reason being that
the reactive bits in ``layer-openstack`` in conjunction with
helpers in ``charms.openstack`` is managing both the server and CA
certificates and rely on the same flags to detect changes.

If we one day offload those tasks to the ``layer-tls-client``
we should add it back in conjunction with removing our code for
this.  At the time of this writing it would not be possible as
``layer-tls-client`` is not spaces aware.

With the above mentioned change we can stop relying on the now
deprecated ``certificates.batch.cert.available`` flag.

We also do not add back the Keystone certificates handling code
as this has been removed from the Keystone charm reference:
openstack/charm-keystone/commit/17b24e7fde8e4c8c276a4f392cbae0d1d0ed2615

Needed-By: I007275c041ca5465664a6b5d441e56c0316c405d

commit_message:
Add default certificates relation handlers

These where moved up to this layer from ``layer-openstack-api``,
removal counterpart: I007275c041ca5465664a6b5d441e56c0316c405d

Guard the default handlers behind check for
'charms.openstack.do-default-certificates.available' flag.  This
flag is activated when the consumer charm makes a call to
charm.use_defaults('certificates.available') from its reactive
handler.  Previously it was always activated for all consumers of
the ``openstack-api`` layer, it should be up to the charm
implementation to choose.

We do not add back ``layer-tls-client``, the reason being that
the reactive bits in ``layer-openstack`` in conjunction with
helpers in ``charms.openstack`` is managing both the server and CA
certificates and rely on the same flags to detect changes.

If we one day offload those tasks to the ``layer-tls-client``
we should add it back in conjunction with removing our code for
this.  At the time of this writing it would not be possible as
``layer-tls-client`` is not spaces aware.

With the above mentioned change we can stop relying on the now
deprecated ``certificates.batch.cert.available`` flag.

We also do not add back the Keystone certificates handling code
as this has been removed from the Keystone charm reference:
openstack/charm-keystone/commit/17b24e7fde8e4c8c276a4f392cbae0d1d0ed2615

Needed-By: I007275c041ca5465664a6b5d441e56c0316c405d
Needed-By: I8a72acd451dd21e1b042b7f71f6d98e164737ac1
Closes-Bug: #1840899
Change-Id: I12f45236632b608e07fdd35d31b90b84ca92eb1f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 12:21:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pep8 error in cyborg/*.py

This patch will first fix pep8 error in cyborg/*.py, but except
the sub dir, like cyborg/api*、cyborg/cmd/*...., these code will
be fixed in the follow patch.

This patch do two things:

1. For the cyborg/context.py, There is no exception called Forbidden
in the cyborg library. I guess this part of the code is referenced
to nova[1]. However, in the nova library [2], they define a Forbidden
class, so we can also defined class Forbidden in cyborg/common/exception.py,
and import it in the format of pep8.

2. For the cyborg/quota.py, just adjust the import order.

[1]. https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/context.py#L300
[2]. https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/exception.py#L162

Change-Id: Ia7b22272412b5e5fe6a5fa0cdf06fff7870bc07d
'}, {'created': '2019-08-28 12:22:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pep8 error in cyborg/*.py

the sub dir, like cyborg/api*、cyborg/cmd/*...., these code will

This patch does two things:

1. Add Forbidden class in cyborg/common/excpetion.py and modify
NotAuthorized class、HTTPForbidden class.

For the cyborg/context.py, There is no exception called Forbidden
in the cyborg library. I guess this part of the code is referenced
to nova[1]. However, in the nova library [2], they define a Forbidden
class, so we can also defined class Forbidden in cyborg/common/exception.py,
and import it in the format of pep8.

At the same time, the content defined by NotAuthorized and
HTTPForbidden is inconsistent with the effect it wants to
achieve, so NotAuthorized and HTTPForbidden are modified here.

2. Adjust the import order in cyborg/quota.py.

[1]. https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/context.py#L300
[2]. https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/exception.py#L162

commit_message:
Fix pep8 error in cyborg/*.py and add Forbidden class

This patch will first fix pep8 error in cyborg/*.py, but except
the sub dir, like cyborg/api*、cyborg/cmd/*...., these code will
be fixed in the follow patch.

This patch does two things:

1. Add Forbidden class in cyborg/common/excpetion.py and modify
NotAuthorized class、HTTPForbidden class.

For the cyborg/context.py, There is no exception called Forbidden
in the cyborg library. I guess this part of the code is referenced
to nova[1]. However, in the nova library [2], they define a Forbidden
class, so we can also defined class Forbidden in cyborg/common/exception.py,
and import it in the format of pep8.

At the same time, the content defined by NotAuthorized and
HTTPForbidden is inconsistent with the effect it wants to
achieve, so NotAuthorized and HTTPForbidden are modified here.

2. Adjust the import order in cyborg/quota.py.

[1]. https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/context.py#L300
[2]. https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/exception.py#L162

Change-Id: Ia7b22272412b5e5fe6a5fa0cdf06fff7870bc07d

commit_message:
Solve execute flake8 stuck in cyborg

When use 'flake8 cyborg/' cmd in cyborg dir, the check
will be stuck.

This reason is beacuse monkey_patch in cyborg/__init__.py.

The solution is to move the monkey_patch to cmd/__init__.py.
Actually, the monkey_patch should be put in cmd dir.

Change-Id: Ic5e79bf43c2a895561e727cf56487c03e09db804

commit_message:
Fix Zun Docker remote API host

This makes WS (so e.g. console) always work with the way we
deploy Zun. Otherwise it used the first IP address.

Change-Id: Ib31c5944be2f6fa00cdf5da3e638a590e6bace40
Closes-bug: #1841243
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2019-09-02 23:53:14.000000000', 'message': 'Modify CreateInstanceTest setUp to initially be OK

Currently the CreateInstanceTest setUp() puts the tests into an initial
fail state by making the backup size greater than the volume size.

This commit moves some lines around so that the initial state is OK
and the failure tests have their environment specifically set.

This is intended to help especially when adding new tests.

Change-Id: I73b15724b06cc35b5c577e7b15e8e58d660e345b
'}]
commit_message:
Modify CreateInstanceTest setUp to initially be OK

Currently the CreateInstanceTest setUp() puts the tests into an initial
fail state by making the backup size greater than the volume size.

This commit moves some lines around so that the initial state is OK
and the failure tests have their environment specifically set.

This is intended to help especially when adding new tests.

Change-Id: I73b15724b06cc35b5c577e7b15e8e58d660e345b

commit_message:
Add a fields meta_data to result of Senlin API

Current, when I call API to list all events with description in here:

https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/clustering/?expanded=list-events-detail#list-events

and in result maybe return event objects with meta_data field and this help useful
for my works. But when i get events use python-senlinclient, i can't do that.
So i want add to meta_data field to response when i use python-senlinclient.
Thanks.

Change-Id: I85d52027f6f20e9ec9a0ffa50dadaeed649b7d7f

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

Change-Id: I3ac8a5cc20e27458e1ed806658a36d6e6952da3d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 05:56:36.000000000', 'message': 'Remove descriptions of nonexistent hacking rules

N321, N328, N329, N330 hacking rules have been removed
since I9c334162fe1799e7b24563fdc11256b91bbafc9f.
However the descriptions are still in HACKING.rst.
So remove them.
The rule number N307 is missing in HACKING.rst.
So add it.

Change-Id: I868c421a0f5a3329ab36f786f8519accae623f1a
Closes-Bug: #1841400
'}]
commit_message:
Remove descriptions of nonexistent hacking rules

N321, N328, N329, N330 hacking rules have been removed
since I9c334162fe1799e7b24563fdc11256b91bbafc9f.
However the descriptions are still in HACKING.rst.
So remove them.
The rule number N307 is missing in HACKING.rst.
So add it.

Change-Id: I868c421a0f5a3329ab36f786f8519accae623f1a
Closes-Bug: #1841400

commit_message:
validate segment with invalid segmentation id 0 in vlan network type

  - this change check 0 as the segmentation id is illegal
    while creating a vlan network.
  - raise invalid input exception when segment with segmentation
    id 0 and missing physical network
  - _sync_vlan_allocations and _parse_network_vlan_ranges have
    such validation.

Change-Id: I61c09376fd79c2f045a6588dc18dfd390b59a437

commit_message:
Replace git.openstack.org URLs with opendev.org URLs

1. Replace git.openstack.org URLs with opendev.org URLs
2. bump tox minversion to 2.0 to keep consistence with magmum[1]

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/tox.ini#L2

Change-Id: Iddc8ca8de4451b7a152f5526ff9f25794dde734e
Closes-Bug: #1826698

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-23 12:04:40.000000000', 'message': "Pass network API to the conducor's MigrationTask

During migraton conductor needs to heal the content of the
RequestSpec.requested_resources field based on the resource requests of
the ports attached to the instance being migrated.

This patch makes sure that The MigrationTask has access the networking
API to do such healing.

blueprint: support-server-move-operations-with-ports-having-resource-request

Change-Id: Idf38568c3c237687c54fbbfcc6c5792c49c95161

commit_message:
Pass network API to the conducor's MigrationTask

During migration conductor needs to heal the content of the
RequestSpec.requested_resources field based on the resource requests of
the ports attached to the instance being migrated.

This patch makes sure that the MigrationTask has access the networking
API to do such healing.

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

Change-Id: Idf38568c3c237687c54fbbfcc6c5792c49c95161

commit_message:
Add a combined_nominations_last_days E-mail template

This is a bit of a mashup from the individual TC and PTL election
templates for the nominations_last_days event.

Change-Id: I1ff77ccceb3fc19015c237a53dfe97dc9127eeda

commit_message:
allow getting resource request of every bound ports of an instance

This patch adds a new network api method
get_requested_resource_for_instance() to query neutron about the
resource needs of the ports currently bound to an instance. A later
patch will use this to properly allocate resource for the ports during
migration.

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

Change-Id: I56ea5ee94139dfa2cdf6bb76656bca2902e7ea9c

    Agreed:

    Publish the blakclist on plugins-registry doc.

    After that make this job voting

    Make process of fixing and removing the faulty plugin which unblock the tempest gate with author self-approve.

    Make sanity job running on plugins which are dependent on each other. For example, congress-tempest-plugin use neutron-tempest-plugin, mistral-tempest-plugin etc so all these plugins should have a sanity jobs which can install and list these plugins tests only not all the plugins.'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2019-05-17 17:54:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Make plugin-sanity-check job as voting

This commit makes plugin-sanity-check job as voting. We should be able
to do it if the job is stable enough.

Change-Id: Ieff34e2b24f5f9228932383490a115a35e7b1767

commit_message:
Bump lower constraint of python-zunclient

Projects that depends on python-zunclient should use the latest
version as lower constraint.

Change-Id: Idc865788f35427cc0f2926b31089ec4097831334

commit_message:
Byte encoding of member Id

From stein we will be porting to python3.
To deal with that, when calling for class PartitionCoordinator
the member id need to be encoded in byte format
otherwise it raises MemberNotInGroupError exception.

Closes-Bug: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2005894
Change-Id: Idee3216c7c1b4f6391d08649637e619ba1a0ac13
(cherry picked from commit 9c9112ad1f07fad457cb76612a43394ece840e06)

commit_message:
Fix TypeError for Indicators resource

This change fixes the TypeError that was being thrown because the
`connection` attribute was being accessed before it was set.

Change-Id: Ib14684046f520d907e8197e0abf310226b9d5693

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-02 11:43:59.000000000', 'message': '[ocata only] Fix alembic requirement

Ceilometer has chosen to not consume upper-constraints.txt, and latest
version of alembic (1.1.0) requires SQLAlchemy 1.1.0, which is
constrained in requirements.txt
This causes error when running py27 tests:

CommandError: SQLAlchemy 1.1.0 or greater is required.

Change-Id: Ie422738b724d1c75779e52f85218fe2c8a4b4243
'}]
commit_message:
[ocata only] Fix alembic requirement

Ceilometer has chosen to not consume upper-constraints.txt, and latest
version of alembic (1.1.0) requires SQLAlchemy 1.1.0, which is
constrained in requirements.txt
This causes error when running py27 tests:

CommandError: SQLAlchemy 1.1.0 or greater is required.

Change-Id: Ie422738b724d1c75779e52f85218fe2c8a4b4243

+2 to dean's side"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-08-31 17:59:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

The -tips failure is in volume tests'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-09-02 12:33:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

IMO this should ignore fields that have None as value. Currently it outputs things like

project.domain_id='None'

which is undistinguishable from fields that have the string "None" as their value.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-09-02 13:42:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

As this is a library function I 'm not convinced that making editorial decisions on content is appropriate here.  There is also a difference between a key being present (valued None) and not being present so omitting them is the same problem in the other direction.

However, yes, out of 'None' == None is misleading."}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-02 18:01:12.000000000', 'message': "trivial: Rewrap definitions of 'NUMACell'

In a future change, I492803eaacc34c69af073689f9159449557919db, we're
going to be adding a new field to all definitions of this object. That
is going to result in a lot of line wrapping which will make the change
a lot harder to grok. Do that wrapping now so that we can make the
functional changes in that future change easier to identify.

Part of blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: Id3441073adde563a568c9550df53690d1e6c998a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
trivial: Rewrap definitions of 'NUMACell'

In a future change, I492803eaacc34c69af073689f9159449557919db, we're
going to be adding a new field to all definitions of this object. That
is going to result in a lot of line wrapping which will make the change
a lot harder to grok. Do that wrapping now so that we can make the
functional changes in that future change easier to identify.

Part of blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: Id3441073adde563a568c9550df53690d1e6c998a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 30906, 'date': '2019-08-30 07:04:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-08-30 07:04:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-30 07:28:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25733, 'date': '2019-09-02 09:44:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Hi, thanks for your contribution!

There is indeed a bug in the code snippet and the fix looks valid.

I can suggest that you take a look at the guide for commit messages for future contributions:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages

If sean-k-mooney is OK with this as-is, I'll convert my +1 to a +2 for this trivial fix."}, {'account_id': 25733, 'date': '2019-09-02 11:04:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-09-02 11:08:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 13:26:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix validation of begin/end in GET /v2/summary endpoint

Before this patch, if any of the "begin" and "end" parameters
were passed to the GET /v2/summary endpoint, validation would fail.

This was caused by "voluptuous.Coerce" being used instead of the
custom "SingleQueryParam" validator.

Change-Id: I09656c742f3ba6b02de3656201f6903f590944bd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix validation of begin/end in GET /v2/summary endpoint

Before this patch, if any of the "begin" and "end" parameters
were passed to the GET /v2/summary endpoint, validation would fail.

This was caused by "voluptuous.Coerce" being used instead of the
custom "SingleQueryParam" validator.

Change-Id: I09656c742f3ba6b02de3656201f6903f590944bd

commit_message:
Use _create_admin_router() where possible

It will automatically set the router for cleanup, so use
it instead of admin_client.create_router().

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I7cff3f164dd76ba5e160cee4566732be10e9276d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 14:14:39.000000000', 'message': 'Use net_default_mac in ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic_pxe_uefi.default.j2

Upstream ironic went from $net_default_ip to $net_default_mac in
ironic/drivers/modules/master_grub_cfg.txt with
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/578959/

This commit makes the same change for
ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic_pxe_uefi.default.j2

Using $net_default_ip breaks ironic standalone deployments with
[dhcp]dhcp_provider = none

Change-Id: I2ca9a66d2bdb0aab5cd9936c8be8206e6ade3bd5
Closes-Bug: 1842078
'}]
commit_message:
Use net_default_mac in ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic_pxe_uefi.default.j2

Upstream ironic went from $net_default_ip to $net_default_mac in
ironic/drivers/modules/master_grub_cfg.txt with
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/578959/

This commit makes the same change for
ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic_pxe_uefi.default.j2

Using $net_default_ip breaks ironic standalone deployments with
[dhcp]dhcp_provider = none

Change-Id: I2ca9a66d2bdb0aab5cd9936c8be8206e6ade3bd5
Closes-Bug: 1842078

commit_message:
Use secure websocket for nova serial console proxy when TLS enabled

This resolves an issue where the web browser would complain that it
was trying to connect to insecure websocket when using HTTPS with
horizon.

Change-Id: Ib75cc2bc1b3811bc31badd5fda3db3ed0c59b119
Closes-Bug: #1841914

commit_message:
Fix validation of segmentation id in vlan type driver

In case when vlan ranges for physical network are defined
it was not validated by vlan type driver if given segmentation_id
is within this configured ranges.
That leads to issue when user was able to create vlan network
with segmentation id outside of range available for specified
physical network.

This commit fixes this issue by adding proper validation of
segmentation_id in vlan type driver. It is now always checked
if segmentation_id is inside configed vlan ranges or
in (MIN_VLAN_TAG, MAX_VLAN_TAG) range if no other ranges are
specified for physical network.

Change-Id: Ie75ea09dc6a737a651e9d12e817c9297e97fc86e
Closes-Bug: #1842052

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-07 18:57:14.000000000', 'message': "add InstanceList.get_all_uuids_by_hosts() method

We have an existing InstanceList.get_all_uuids_by_host() (note: single
host) method that returns the instance UUIDs for one host. This patch
adds an InstanceList.get_all_uuids_by_hosts() method that accepts an
iterable of host names and returns a dict, keyed by host name, of the
list of instance UUIDs associated with that host.

In writing this patch, I changed the implementation of the DB API's
_instance_get_all_uuids_by_host method to *not* use the model_query()
helper method and instead just use the sqlalchemy core expression API to
construct the SELECT statement.

Following patches modify the scheduler's host manager to take advantage
of this faster batch retrieval of many host -> instance UUIDs mapping to
avoid doing multiple queries for selected compute nodes in the
scheduler.

Change-Id: If92fe8b75d20a738f37e2a74c52c59bfc699a74f

commit_message:
add InstanceList.get_all_uuids_by_hosts() method

We have an existing InstanceList.get_all_uuids_by_host() (note: single
host) method that returns the instance UUIDs for one host. This patch
adds an InstanceList.get_all_uuids_by_hosts() method that accepts an
iterable of host names and returns a dict, keyed by host name, of the
list of instance UUIDs associated with that host.

In writing this patch, I changed the implementation of the DB API's
_instance_get_all_uuids_by_host method to *not* use the model_query()
helper method and instead just use the sqlalchemy core expression API to
construct the SELECT statement.

Following patches modify the scheduler's host manager to take advantage
of this faster batch retrieval of many host -> instance UUIDs mapping to
avoid doing multiple queries for selected compute nodes in the
scheduler.

Change-Id: If92fe8b75d20a738f37e2a74c52c59bfc699a74f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 14:04:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fix filter() usage for Py 3

The use of filter() within the codebase expected the output to be
an interator, but the filter function in Python 3 now returns a
lazy loading generator and resulted in stack traces.

This commit replaces the use of filter() (+ lambdas) with more
readable list comprehension to be compatible with Python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: I56af1dc1f6648ec334f901cb59893240b0125031
'}]
commit_message:
Fix filter() usage for Py 3

The use of filter() within the codebase expected the output to be
an interator, but the filter function in Python 3 now returns a
lazy loading generator and resulted in stack traces.

This commit replaces the use of filter() (+ lambdas) with more
readable list comprehension to be compatible with Python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: I56af1dc1f6648ec334f901cb59893240b0125031

commit_message:
Delete default gnocchi & aodh wsgi conf in Ubuntu binary

Ubuntu distro package will create default wsgi conf in apache
during gnocchi-api and aodh-api installation. We need to delete
them since we only use the conf that pushed by kolla-ansible.

Change-Id: Ib31e733eba12deebdf469c306dfba4191a1b89f5
Related-Bug: 1832306
Related-Bug: 1836520
(cherry picked from commit 5eb780d0b0d12186c57b828320c3421b98b97840)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 13:09:44.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Consumer_types: the database and object bits

WIP: needs tests

In advance of a microversion 1.37, add the necessary database and object
code to support saving consumer types when creating consumers and
reporting those types when requesting usage information.

A consumer type object is added, similar to trait and resource class.
Like those there is a set of default data which needs to be ensured
at process startup time. In this case it is one row in the table:
ID 1 with value UNKNOWN. This is the default value for an
unspecified consumer type.

In future changes we may wish to AttributeCache consumer types in
the same way that traits and resource classes are cached.

Usage object can now be retrieved by consumer type and include
consumer type information when retrieved. Until 1.37 that info
will not be used in results.

Allocations are written and retrieved with a consumer type but
the data is not yet presented in HTTP requests.

Story: 2005473
Task: 36420
Change-Id: Ib57ba2e046acb0e5b0f717d85557caf40fa0d515

commit_message:
Consumer_types: the database and object bits

In advance of a microversion 1.37, add the necessary database and object
code to support saving consumer types when creating consumers and
reporting those types when requesting usage information.

A consumer type object is added, similar to trait and resource class.
Like those there is a set of default data which needs to be ensured
at process startup time. In this case it is one row in the table:
ID 1 with value UNKNOWN. This is the default value for an
unspecified consumer type.

In future changes we may wish to AttributeCache consumer types in
the same way that traits and resource classes are cached.

Usage object can now be retrieved by consumer type and include
consumer type information when retrieved. Until 1.37 that info
will not be used in results.

Allocations are written and retrieved with a consumer type but
the data is not yet presented in HTTP requests.

Story: 2005473
Task: 36420
Co-Authored-By: Surya Seetharaman <suryaseetharaman.9@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ib57ba2e046acb0e5b0f717d85557caf40fa0d515

commit_message:
Fix cell_v2 discover_hosts when Ironic enabled

When Ironic used the 'cell_v2 discover_hosts' should be executed
with '--by-service' option, otherwise the hosts doesn't discoverd.

Change-Id: I213be691187b261523c2d3b1c51b2da8a50b412a
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8af53d4f9b3ded4bd5ab4b57088cb57f339d9732)

commit_message:
Support management security group

Allow the cloud admin to control the security groups on the management
port of Trove instance, a new config option `management_security_groups`
is introduced for that purpose.

Change-Id: I4b22b87d37792be700d4ec7f78a7ea479ddb5814
Story: 2006466
Task: 36395

subject: Convert network UUID to name required for OCCM
messages:
[{'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-08-22 17:08:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-08-23 11:50:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-08-23 11:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-08-25 18:08:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-08-25 21:42:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-08-25 22:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-08-28 11:49:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Won't this break if we have two networks with the same name?

The occm won't know which network to pick.

Would it be acceptable for you to drop this until we fix occm to use uuid?"}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-08-28 12:24:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Won't this break if we have two networks with the same name?
 > 
 > The occm won't know which network to pick.
 > 
 > Would it be acceptable for you to drop this until we fix occm to
 > use uuid?

It would not break unless both networks with the same name are both attached to the same instance. The check iterates over the list of networks attached to the instance, not the list of networks available globally."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-08-28 15:49:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

> > Won't this break if we have two networks with the same name?
 > >
 > > The occm won't know which network to pick.
 > >
 > > Would it be acceptable for you to drop this until we fix occm to
 > > use uuid?
 > 
 > It would not break unless both networks with the same name are both
 > attached to the same instance. The check iterates over the list of
 > networks attached to the instance, not the list of networks
 > available globally.

LGTM then, devstacktested it"}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-08-28 15:50:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

conformance with flannel and flannel_backend=vxlan passes.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-08-30 07:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-09-02 02:34:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Sorry, I forgot to mention that sonobuoy passed for me as well based on v1.13.10 and flannel_backend=vxlan

Given the vxlan is the recommend way by https://github.com/coreos/flannel/blob/master/Documentation/backends.md i'm going to update the default option for flannel_backend"}]

commit_message:
Convert network UUID to name required for OCCM

Sometimes, the fixed_network value gets rendered as UUID. However OCCM's
internal-network-name requires the network name, it does not support
UUID. This patch introduces a new parameter called fixed_network_name
which converts fixed_network UUID to name if it is UUID-like.

Story: 2005333
Task: 36313

Change-Id: I3453bc0dbea285687d39c9782685cb1f2a3ecd39

'}, {'created': '2019-08-19 21:45:05.000000000', 'message': "Fixes for deploying nova-less undercloud

This commmit contains the fixes required to successfully deploy a
nova-less undercloud:

1. Also disable undercloud glance with nova

  When nova is switched off there are no consumers of glance left, so
  the glance API should be disabled too.

2. Don't mount /etc/nova into placement migrate script

  The script mysql-migrate-db.sh [1] is driven entirely by environment
  variables, and only does direct database operations, so there is no
  need for a configured /etc/nova to exist within the container which
  runs it.

  This change removes the unused bind mount to
  /var/lib/config-data/nova/etc/nova/. This directory doesn't exist
  when nova isn't deployed, so this change allows placement to be
  deployed without nova (which is a valid use-case).

3. Override MistralExecutorVolumes

  This variable contains a mount to /var/lib/config-data/nova which
  doesn't exist in a nova-less undercloud

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/src/branch/master/placement_db_tools/mysql-migrate-db.sh

Change-Id: If8733240e273ba1eedb7bea51548ac346c96d644
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy
"}, {'created': '2019-08-20 22:14:10.000000000', 'message': "Fixes for deploying nova-less undercloud

This commmit contains the fixes required to successfully deploy a
nova-less undercloud:

1. Also disable undercloud glance with nova

  When nova is switched off there are no consumers of glance left, so
  the glance API should be disabled too.

2. Don't mount /etc/nova into placement migrate script

  The script mysql-migrate-db.sh [1] is driven entirely by environment
  variables, and only does direct database operations, so there is no
  need for a configured /etc/nova to exist within the container which
  runs it.

  This change removes the unused bind mount to
  /var/lib/config-data/nova/etc/nova/. This directory doesn't exist
  when nova isn't deployed, so this change allows placement to be
  deployed without nova (which is a valid use-case).

3. Allow return code 5 (db connection error) from mysql-migrate-db.sh

  When nova is not deployed, the nova_api database user won't exist
  and mysql-migrate-db.sh will exit with error code 5. Add 5 to the
  list of allowed exit codes, and switch to paunch's inbuilt support
  for exit_codes instead of doing it in bash

4. Override MistralExecutorVolumes

  This variable contains a mount to /var/lib/config-data/nova which
  doesn't exist in a nova-less undercloud

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/src/branch/master/placement_db_tools/mysql-migrate-db.sh

Change-Id: If8733240e273ba1eedb7bea51548ac346c96d644
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes for deploying nova-less undercloud

This commmit contains the fixes required to successfully deploy a
nova-less undercloud:

1. Also disable undercloud glance with nova

  When nova is switched off there are no consumers of glance left, so
  the glance API should be disabled too.

2. Don't mount /etc/nova into placement migrate script

  The script mysql-migrate-db.sh [1] is driven entirely by environment
  variables, and only does direct database operations, so there is no
  need for a configured /etc/nova to exist within the container which
  runs it.

  This change removes the unused bind mount to
  /var/lib/config-data/nova/etc/nova/. This directory doesn't exist
  when nova isn't deployed, so this change allows placement to be
  deployed without nova (which is a valid use-case).

3. Allow return code 5 (db connection error) from mysql-migrate-db.sh

  When nova is not deployed, the nova_api database user won't exist
  and mysql-migrate-db.sh will exit with error code 5. Add 5 to the
  list of allowed exit codes, and switch to paunch's inbuilt support
  for exit_codes instead of doing it in bash

4. Override MistralExecutorVolumes

  This variable contains a mount to /var/lib/config-data/nova which
  doesn't exist in a nova-less undercloud

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/src/branch/master/placement_db_tools/mysql-migrate-db.sh

Change-Id: If8733240e273ba1eedb7bea51548ac346c96d644
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
Add cold migrate and resize to nova-grenade-multinode

Changes in [1] could potentially break a mixed-compute-version
environment as we don't have grenade coverage for cold migrate and
resize. This adds that coverage to the nova-grenade-multinode
job.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655721/10

Change-Id: I81372d610ddf8abb473621deb6e7cb68eb000fee

[{'created': '2019-08-27 13:41:02.000000000', 'message': "Add resize tests to nova-grenade job

To cover resize and migrate RPC changes in nova with grenade this patch
renames the nova-grenade-live-migration job to nova-grenade-multinode
and adds runs the resize tempest tests as part of the job.

Changes in [1] could potentially break a mixed-compute-version
environment as we don't have grenade coverage.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655721/10

Change-Id: I7571ff508fcccba40cf2307a8788c1850d2d9fd8

commit_message:
Rename the nova-grenade-live-migration job to nova-grenade-multinode

We are planning to add non-live-migration multinode tests to this job
so first we rename it to be more generic.

Change-Id: I7571ff508fcccba40cf2307a8788c1850d2d9fd8

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-03-01 20:18:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I have tested this with devstack on SEV-capable hardware and it works beautifully:

https://pasteboard.co/I3rPhvJ.png

If I change the kvm-amd kernel module's sev parameter to 0 (rmmod then modprobe) and restart or SIGHUP devstack@n-cpu then the SEV trait vanishes, and if I revert it to 1, the trait comes back.  Similarly if I tweak the code to change the check of the <sev supported="..."> feature element.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-03-01 20:59:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(5 comments)

looks good, thanks Adam :)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-05 17:40:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

As far as I can tell, there is no code proposed yet to translate the SEV required trait from the flavor and configure the guest XML appropriately, is that correct? Because some change would need to build on top of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/636318/ right? So I'm not sure what point there would be in merging this change in Stein when it's not useful to rely on it, i.e. as an operator I can't configure my hosts and flavors to be scheduled to a compute with SEV support and get a guest configured based on the required trait - which would arguably be a bug."}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-03-05 20:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> As far as I can tell, there is no code proposed yet to translate the SEV required trait from the flavor and configure the guest XML appropriately, is that correct?

Almost :-)  At least one of Boris's patches laying the groundwork for that is already in Gerrit, but it still needs a bit of work:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/636318/2/nova/virt/libvirt/config.py

The other patches exist and are nearly ready but not in Gerrit quite yet.

> Because some change would need to build on top of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/636318/ right? So I'm not sure what point there would be in merging this change in Stein when it's not useful to rely on it, i.e. as an operator I can't configure my hosts and flavors to be scheduled to a compute with SEV support and get a guest configured based on the required trait - which would arguably be a bug.

Yeah, technically I agree, although in practice I'd be surprised if any operator would even notice the new trait (since AFAICS it requires a fairly obscure "openstack resource provider trait list --os-placement-api-version 1.6" command), let alone try to do something useful with it without at least first googling it and finding out about the spec and ongoing work :)

One benefit of merging pre-Stein would be to avoid needless rebases later on.  And as mentioned in #openstack-nova just now, another would be to reduce the amount of backporting work SUSE is likely going to need to do to carry this downstream, but of course if that conflicted with any upstream goals then I would entirely sympathise with the upstream position.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-03-05 21:46:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-03-05 21:47:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-22 15:01:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add new "supports_amd_sev" capability to libvirt driver

Add a new capability to the libvirt driver which indicates the ability
of the compute host to boot instances with AMD SEV (Secure Encrypted
Virtualization) enabled.

Automatically detect the presence of SEV functionality during
init_host() by checking that:

   a) 'sev' parameter of the kvm-amd kernel module is enabled, and

   b) the <features> element returned from libvirt's
      virConnectGetDomainCapabilities API contains an

         <sev supported='yes'>

      element.  This second check is achieved by utilising the domain
      capability retrieval and parsing code which was added in
      I4c35b6a27db05349213429422ffe62adb09bd921.

The change also depends on I15364d37fb7426f4eec00ca4eaf99bec50e964b6
and Ic4c16b23834b43a258be5073e32bcdb9c0421f02 in order to map the
capability to the standard trait HW_CPU_AMD_SEV which already exists
in os-traits from 0.11.0.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I2b41f1cce0af8b9d36b74a4663aa4ff227e17cc6

'}, {'created': '2019-04-25 15:37:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add new "supports_amd_sev" capability to libvirt driver

Add a new capability to the libvirt driver which indicates the ability
of the compute host to boot instances with AMD SEV (Secure Encrypted
Virtualization) enabled.

Automatically detect the presence of SEV functionality during
init_host() by checking that:

   a) 'sev' parameter of the kvm-amd kernel module is enabled, and

   b) the <features> element returned from libvirt's
      virConnectGetDomainCapabilities API contains an

         <sev supported='yes'>

      element.  This second check is achieved by utilising the domain
      capability retrieval and parsing code which was added in
      I4c35b6a27db05349213429422ffe62adb09bd921.

The change also depends on two changes which are already merged:

  - Convert driver supported capabilities to compute node provider traits
    (I15364d37fb7426f4eec00ca4eaf99bec50e964b6)

  - Change LibvirtDriver.capabilities to an instance variable
    (Ic4c16b23834b43a258be5073e32bcdb9c0421f02)

in order to map the capability to the standard trait HW_CPU_AMD_SEV
which already exists in os-traits from 0.11.0.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I2b41f1cce0af8b9d36b74a4663aa4ff227e17cc6

'}, {'created': '2019-05-24 17:10:22.000000000', 'message': "Provide HW_CPU_AMD_SEV trait when SEV is supported

Add the final piece of the SEV detection code to init_host() in the
libvirt driver, by checking that:

   a) 'sev' parameter of the kvm-amd kernel module is enabled, and

   b) the <features> element returned from libvirt's
      virConnectGetDomainCapabilities API contains an

         <sev supported='yes'>

      element.  This second check is achieved by utilising the domain
      capability retrieval and parsing code which was added in
      I4c35b6a27db05349213429422ffe62adb09bd921.

When both checks pass, provide the standard trait HW_CPU_AMD_SEV,
which already exists in os-traits from 0.11.0, on the resource
provider for the compute host.  This indicates the ability of the
compute host to boot instances with AMD SEV (Secure Encrypted
Virtualization) enabled.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I2b41f1cce0af8b9d36b74a4663aa4ff227e17cc6

Change-Id: I2b41f1cce0af8b9d36b74a4663aa4ff227e17cc6
"}, {'created': '2019-07-24 10:59:57.000000000', 'message': "Provide HW_CPU_X86_AMD_SEV trait when SEV is supported

Add code to init_host() in the libvirt driver which detects support
for AMD SEV in the compute host hardware and hypervisor, by checking
that:

   a) 'sev' parameter of the kvm-amd kernel module is enabled, and

   b) the <features> element returned from libvirt's
      virConnectGetDomainCapabilities API contains an

         <sev supported='yes'>

      element.  This second check is achieved by utilising the domain
      capability retrieval and parsing code which was added in
      I4c35b6a27db05349213429422ffe62adb09bd921.

When both checks pass, provide the standard trait HW_CPU_X86_AMD_SEV
(which was newly available in os-traits 0.13.0) on the resource
provider for the compute host.  This indicates the ability of the
compute host to boot instances with AMD SEV (Secure Encrypted
Virtualization) enabled.

Note that this is not the last of the detection code.  Future commits
will add support for the use of a new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource
class in the compute host inventory which tracks how many guests with
encrypted memory can be run on a host concurrently.  Until that point,
SEV functionality cannot be used, and this trait is effectively
dormant.

Since the functional test setup is near identical to that already used
in test_shared_resource_provider.py, extract it into a new base class
called LibvirtProviderUsageBaseTestCase in a new file:

    nova/tests/functional/libvirt/integrated_helpers.py

and reuse that for the new tests.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I2b41f1cce0af8b9d36b74a4663aa4ff227e17cc6

      capability retrieval and parsing code which was added in
      I4c35b6a27db05349213429422ffe62adb09bd921.

When both checks pass, provide the standard trait HW_CPU_X86_AMD_SEV
(which was newly available in os-traits 0.13.0) on the resource
provider for the compute host.  This indicates the ability of the
compute host to boot instances with AMD SEV (Secure Encrypted
Virtualization) enabled.

Note that this is not the last of the detection code.  Future commits
will add support for the use of a new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource
class in the compute host inventory which tracks how many guests with
encrypted memory can be run on a host concurrently.  Until that point,
SEV functionality cannot be used, and this trait is effectively
dormant.

Since the functional test setup is near identical to that already used
in test_shared_resource_provider.py, extract it into a new base class
called LibvirtProviderUsageBaseTestCase in a new file:

    nova/tests/functional/libvirt/integrated_helpers.py

and reuse that for the new tests.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I2b41f1cce0af8b9d36b74a4663aa4ff227e17cc6

"}, {'created': '2019-08-30 09:37:16.000000000', 'message': "Provide HW_CPU_X86_AMD_SEV trait when SEV is supported

Add code to init_host() in the libvirt driver which detects support
for AMD SEV in the compute host hardware and hypervisor, by checking
that:

   a) 'sev' parameter of the kvm-amd kernel module is enabled, and

   b) the <features> element returned from libvirt's
      virConnectGetDomainCapabilities API contains an

         <sev supported='yes'>

      element.  This second check is achieved by utilising the domain
      capability retrieval and parsing code which was added in
      I4c35b6a27db05349213429422ffe62adb09bd921.

When both checks pass, provide the standard trait HW_CPU_X86_AMD_SEV
(which was newly available in os-traits 0.13.0) on the resource
provider for the compute host.  This indicates the ability of the
compute host to boot instances with AMD SEV (Secure Encrypted
Virtualization) enabled.

Note that this is not the last of the detection code.  Future commits
will add support for the use of a new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource
class in the compute host inventory which tracks how many guests with
encrypted memory can be run on a host concurrently.  Until that point,
SEV functionality cannot be used, and this trait is effectively
dormant.

commit_message:
Provide HW_CPU_X86_AMD_SEV trait when SEV is supported

Add code to init_host() in the libvirt driver which detects support
for AMD SEV in the compute host hardware and hypervisor, by checking
that:

   a) 'sev' parameter of the kvm-amd kernel module is enabled, and

   b) the <features> element returned from libvirt's
      virConnectGetDomainCapabilities API contains an

         <sev supported='yes'>

      element.  This second check is achieved by utilising the domain
      capability retrieval and parsing code which was added in
      I4c35b6a27db05349213429422ffe62adb09bd921.

When both checks pass, provide the standard trait HW_CPU_X86_AMD_SEV
(which was newly available in os-traits 0.13.0) on the resource
provider for the compute host.  This indicates the ability of the
compute host to boot instances with AMD SEV (Secure Encrypted
Virtualization) enabled.

Note that this is not the last of the detection code.  Future commits
will add support for the use of a new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource
class in the compute host inventory which tracks how many guests with
encrypted memory can be run on a host concurrently.  Until that point,
SEV functionality cannot be used, and this trait is effectively
dormant.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I2b41f1cce0af8b9d36b74a4663aa4ff227e17cc6

commit_message:
Mark IBM Flashsystem Drivers Unsupported

The IBM driver CIs stopped reporting some time
ago and attempts to reach out to driver maintainers
have failed.

As a result, we need to mark the drivers unsupported
for the T release.

Change-Id: I2c41448fa5ea19ac80f1b4b663222da2ca5ec8f9

commit_message:
Mark the IBM Storwize driver unsupported

The IBM driver CIs stopped reporting some time
ago and attempts to reach out to driver maintainers
have failed.

As a result, we need to mark the drivers unsupported
for the T release.

Change-Id: I0a65e4b72e3739dac576924dec11cd8eab3fcccc

commit_message:
Unbreak CI: fluentd

fluentd - we are not deploying kubernetes, no need for plugins

In the original commit we also dropped Tripleo from the gate, but in
Rocky the Tripleo job did not exist.

Change-Id: I203f70176af7f2b53398ddeb5c21e6234a45e268
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 07b55048e63f27c1045735624c845d1af95a11fd)
(cherry picked from commit b5a6da0dd7735e272ff2e2d1b6d931036601f308)

[{'created': '2019-06-24 14:11:48.000000000', 'message': "Fix: Quota update successfully executes with no params

Since all params of quota update command are optional (except
project_id), when no quota field is supplied the command shouldn't
execute successfully.
This patch shows an error in this case.

Change-Id: I22e5ef7900631d1394e0ab5b57c4e4444f0d5a50
Closes-Bug: #1778975
"}]
commit_message:
Fix: Quota update successfully executes with no params

Since all params of quota update command are optional (except
project_id), when no quota field is supplied the command shouldn't
execute successfully.
This patch shows an error in this case.

Change-Id: I22e5ef7900631d1394e0ab5b57c4e4444f0d5a50
Closes-Bug: #1778975

commit_message:
Add list_supported_drivers test

This patch adds a list_supported_drivers test for unit and functional
tests.

The reason to have this test in the functional tests is to prevent new
Cinder drivers from inadvertedly breaking cinderlib.

Related-Bug: #1838225
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/673467
Change-Id: I6c7932b7997c92ddc689148615bfe2ee909c41e7

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-13 11:40:42.000000000', 'message': 'Support setting attach_mode

We cannot set the attach_mode when connecting or attaching a volume
because the "Connection.connect" method is blindly using
"attach_mode='rw'".

This patch makes it possible to pass the "attach_mode" to both the
volume attach and the volume connect operation.  Setting the
"access_mode" in the connection info, like Cinder does.

Closes-Bug: #1819706
Change-Id: Ie1e82d52ca5f8f1be1249756963f72d545a26288
'}, {'created': '2019-03-14 10:56:55.000000000', 'message': 'Support setting attach_mode

We cannot set the attach_mode when connecting or attaching a volume
because the "Connection.connect" method is blindly using
"attach_mode='rw'".

This patch makes it possible to pass the "attach_mode" to both the
volume attach and the volume connect operation.  Setting the
"access_mode" in the connection info, like Cinder does.

Closes-Bug: #1819706
Change-Id: Ie1e82d52ca5f8f1be1249756963f72d545a26288
'}]
commit_message:
Support setting attach_mode

We cannot set the attach_mode when connecting or attaching a volume
because the "Connection.connect" method is blindly using
"attach_mode='rw'".

This patch makes it possible to pass the "attach_mode" to both the
volume attach and the volume connect operation.  Setting the
"access_mode" in the connection info, like Cinder does.

Closes-Bug: #1819706
Change-Id: Ie1e82d52ca5f8f1be1249756963f72d545a26288

commit_message:
Add a job for testing zun standalone deployment

After integrating with placement, there are two deployment mode:
* Hybrid mode: a compute host resource provider is managed by both
  nova-compute and zun-compute.
* Standalone mode: a compute host resource provider is managed by
  zun-compute solely.

This commit adds a job for testing standalone mode. The hybrid mode
is covered by existing jobs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677094/
Change-Id: I756040f307d12c93bfecfe33ff52222f3a0bfbbe

Remove races in floating ip functional tests

Multiple subnets with the same name are occasionally created when
running tests in parallel.

Change-Id: Ifb85e39ee53b529e2b97abf782c7fba93d48e9e2
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Move live_migration test hooks under gate/

This patch resolves a TODO in the .zuul.yaml about using common
irrelevant files in our dsvm jobs. To be able to do that we need to move
the test hooks from nova/tests/live_migraton under gate/.

Change-Id: I4e5352fd1a99ff2b4134a734eac6626be772caf1

commit_message:
Add uwsgi role to the requirments

In order to test with integrated repo or use the new uwsgi role,
we need to add it to the requirments list to clone it during deployment.

Also we want to collect uwsgi configs for futher debug.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676410
Change-Id: I317a28e7916536045fd1d535844885f45205e14c

commit_message:
Ensure online migrations have a unique name

As noted at [1], we rely on the names of migration functions in the
output of 'online_data_migrations' command. Enforce this in tests.

The test is renamed to match what it's testing so I can find it by
grepping.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/537414/19/nova/cmd/manage.py@697

Change-Id: I5a4b9b8648dbfccf7afc64f00bb86b0e01cbb671
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Unbreak CI: fluentd

fluentd - we are not deploying kubernetes, no need for plugins

In the original commit we also dropped Tripleo from the gate, but in
Rocky the Tripleo job did not exist.

Change-Id: I203f70176af7f2b53398ddeb5c21e6234a45e268
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 07b55048e63f27c1045735624c845d1af95a11fd)
(cherry picked from commit b5a6da0dd7735e272ff2e2d1b6d931036601f308)

commit_message:
Workaround: Pin neutron source to avoid migration issue

This change should be reverted once the issue has been resolved.

Neutron bootstrap is currently failing on Ubuntu bionic
(kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source jobs) with the following error:

pymysql.err.InternalError: (1832, "Cannot change column 'network_id':
used in a foreign key constraint 'subnets_ibfk_1'")

The change in neutron that added the breaking migration is
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677221, and we are pinning to the commit
before that.

Change-Id: Ic08399940ee7e8e7eed98e12c24ba3d80fbb3696
Related-Bug: #1841907

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 07:21:09.000000000', 'message': 'Remove Accept header with empty value for HEAD and DELETE requests

According to RFC 2616, 7231 If server does not support requested content
type it should return 406 (not acceptable) RC. In case of HEAD or DELETE
we are not interested in the body of the response, but we should not
request missing content type. Either do not send this header at all, or
at least send "*/*" instead of empty value. Any project can start
following this spec at any time.

P.S. Due to some funny patch in my cloud Swift is rejecting all requests
(406) with "Accept: " header.

Change-Id: Id443bec2cbe80b3c3d1ad2a7208edac0dde4b21b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Accept header with empty value for HEAD and DELETE requests

According to RFC 2616, 7231 If server does not support requested content
type it should return 406 (not acceptable) RC. In case of HEAD or DELETE
we are not interested in the body of the response, but we should not
request missing content type. Either do not send this header at all, or
at least send "*/*" instead of empty value. Any project can start
following this spec at any time.

P.S. Due to some funny patch in my cloud Swift is rejecting all requests
(406) with "Accept: " header.

Change-Id: Id443bec2cbe80b3c3d1ad2a7208edac0dde4b21b

commit_message:
DNM: Update ubuntu image to 19.04

Ubuntu 19.04 includes mariadb 10.3, which should avoid the current issue
with neutron.

Change-Id: Ie26623183a9e5e5d54456b73b79667ba9cf61f54
Related-Bug: #1841907

commit_message:
nova: Fix /var/lib/nova file permissions

/var/lib/nova/* needs to be accessible by the nova user. Also add a
missing requires on "tooz".

Change-Id: If67649f8f9bff0a55d6463882a9fdcc7b37baa93

commit_message:
Create the tripleo-sshd role

This role configures the sshd service and related
issue and motd banners that are displayed during
SSH login.

Story: 2006023
Task: 34628
Task: 34630
Task: 34631
Change-Id: I1af1b95ede5f2ed61126ef345d4c87d950fa2525
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

commit_message:
Follow up for specifying az to unshelve

Because of the 'availability_zone' was required in microversion 2.77,
so in v2.77, the 'availability_zone' is True. The logical of
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663851/43/nova/api/openstack/compute/shelve.py@90
is duplicated and redundant, so remove it.

Change-Id: I4618e4a08465c12daae793ec4ade2712e43637aa

commit_message:
Add python3 file for additional images

In addition to hardened images
(https://review.opendev.org/#/q/I953c5648ac79dc8a59fd4bc798c21e6e383e1afc)
a python3 file needs to be added to support RHEL 8 for hardened uefi and
realtime-compute images.

Change-Id: Ic4f9a7a6128842f54dc70f51adb74067acc7bc8a
(cherry picked from commit ce5d049c1eee25a701d6e4f243ed02e91553f345)

[{'created': '2019-08-23 22:06:33.000000000', 'message': 'Sort bootstrap node check for container_puppet_tasks

Previously, the task that checks if container_puppet_tasks should be
written to the bootstrap node was not sorted, which meant the order was
undefined coming out of the Ansible inventory.

This patch adds a sort filter to the check so that by convention the
first node is chosen from the inventory.

Change-Id: I6b93f5b0747c5a11d24615a3bbb5516f9be81401
'}, {'created': '2019-08-26 20:39:59.000000000', 'message': 'Sort bootstrap node check for container_puppet_tasks

Previously, the task that checks if container_puppet_tasks should be
written to the bootstrap node was not sorted, which meant the order was
undefined coming out of the Ansible inventory.

This patch adds a sort filter to the check so that by convention the
first node is chosen from the inventory.

A variable, sorted_bootstrap_node, is also added to control the sorting
in the bootstrap_node.j2 template from the tripleo-hieradata role so
that the 2 patches can merge independently of one another. Otherwise, a
co-dependency would exist.

See I3d595ea5b84f940a3b2dbc69798f69fe03529c10 for the tripleo-ansible
patch.

Change-Id: I6b93f5b0747c5a11d24615a3bbb5516f9be81401

undefined coming out of the Ansible inventory.

first node is chosen from the inventory.

A variable, sorted_bootstrap_node, is also added to control the sorting
in the bootstrap_node.j2 template from the tripleo-hieradata role so
that the tripleo-ansible patch is able to merge first.

Depends-On: I3d595ea5b84f940a3b2dbc69798f69fe03529c10

Change-Id: I6b93f5b0747c5a11d24615a3bbb5516f9be81401

commit_message:
Sort bootstrap node check for container_puppet_tasks

Previously, the task that checks if container_puppet_tasks should be
written to the bootstrap node was not sorted, which meant the order was
undefined coming out of the Ansible inventory.

This patch adds a sort filter to the check so that by convention the
first node is chosen from the inventory.

A variable, sorted_bootstrap_node, is also added to control the sorting
in the bootstrap_node.j2 template from the tripleo-hieradata role so
that the tripleo-ansible patch is able to merge first.

Depends-On: I3d595ea5b84f940a3b2dbc69798f69fe03529c10

Change-Id: I6b93f5b0747c5a11d24615a3bbb5516f9be81401

subject: Constrain molecule
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 22:11:44.000000000', 'message': "Constrain molecule

This change constrains molecule so we're not pulling in broken or otherwise
incompatible code. Recent changes to upstream molecule have introduced some
instability. To ensure we're always testing with an expected release of
molecule a new upper constraint has been added.

Additionally to ensure we're not creating testing gaps, a modification has
been added to the role addition job definition. This will ensure we're
exercising molecule in the event that any of its requirements change in the
future.

Change-Id: Ib12e9a52ace6d3545757ada6863e58843de99ad9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Constrain molecule

This change constrains molecule so we're not pulling in broken or otherwise
incompatible code. Recent changes to upstream molecule have introduced some
instability. To ensure we're always testing with an expected release of
molecule a new upper constraint has been added.

Additionally to ensure we're not creating testing gaps, a modification has
been added to the role addition job definition. This will ensure we're
exercising molecule in the event that any of its requirements change in the
future.

Change-Id: Ib12e9a52ace6d3545757ada6863e58843de99ad9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
